1.verse: Torah Is a Tree of Wisdom Psalm 1 - Happy is the one who has not walked in the advice of the wicked, nor stood in the way of sinners, nor sat in the seat of scoffers.

2.verse: But his delight is in the Torah of ADONAI, and on His Torah he meditates day and night.

3.verse: He will be like a planted tree over streams of water, producing its fruit during its season. Its leaf never droops— but in all he does, he succeeds.

4.verse: The wicked are not so. For they are like chaff that the wind blows away.

5.verse: Therefore the wicked will not stand during the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

6.verse: For ADONAI knows the way of the righteous, but the way of the wicked leads to ruin.

1.verse: Coronation of Messianic King Psalm 2 - Why are the nations in an uproar, and the peoples mutter vanity?

2.verse: The kings of earth set themselves up and rulers conspire together against ADONAI and against His Anointed One:

3.verse: “Let’s rip their chains apart, and throw their ropes off us!”

4.verse: He who sits in heaven laughs! ADONAI mocks them.

5.verse: So He will speak to them in His anger, and terrify them in His fury:

6.verse: “I have set up My king upon Zion, My holy mountain.”

7.verse: I will declare the decree of ADONAI. He said to me: “You are My Son— today I have become Your Father.

8.verse: Ask Me, and I will give the nations as Your inheritance, and the far reaches of the earth as Your possession.

9.verse: You shall break the nations with an iron scepter. You shall dash them in pieces like a potter’s jar.”

10.verse: So now, O kings, be wise, take warning, O judges of the earth!

11.verse: Serve ADONAI with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

12.verse: Kiss the Son, lest He become angry, and you perish along your way— since His wrath may flare up suddenly. Happy is everyone taking refuge in Him!

1.verse: Magen David Psalm 3 - A Psalm of David, when he fled from his son Absalom.

2.verse: ADONAI, how many are my foes! Many are rising up against me!

3.verse: Many are saying to my soul: “There is no deliverance for him in God.” Selah

4.verse: But You, ADONAI, are a shield around me, my glory and the lifter of my head.

5.verse: I cry out to ADONAI with my voice, and He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah

6.verse: I lie down and sleep. I awake—for ADONAI sustains me.

7.verse: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people all around who have taken their stand against me.

8.verse: Arise, ADONAI! Deliver me, my God! For you strike all my enemies on the cheek. You shatter the teeth of the wicked.

1.verse: Prayer for Sleep in Shalom Psalm 4 - For the music director, on stringed instruments, a psalm of David.

2.verse: Answer me when I call, God of my righteousness! You set me free when I am in distress. Be gracious to me and hear my prayer.

3.verse: O sons of men, how long will you turn my glory into my shame? How long will you love worthlessness and pursue falsehood? Selah

4.verse: But know that ADONAI has set apart the godly for His own. ADONAI will hear when I call to Him.

5.verse: Tremble, but do not sin! Search your heart while on your bed, and be silent. Selah

6.verse: Offer righteous sacrifices and put your trust in ADONAI.

7.verse: Many are asking, “Who will show us some good?” May the light of Your face shine upon us, ADONAI!

8.verse: You have put joy in my heart— more joy than when their grain and new wine overflow.

1.verse: Morning Prayer for Justice Psalm 5 - For the music director, on the wind instruments, a psalm of David.

2.verse: Hear my words, ADONAI, consider my groaning.

3.verse: Listen to the sound of my cry for help, my King and my God, for I pray to you.

4.verse: ADONAI, in the morning You hear my voice. In the morning I order my prayer before You and watch expectantly.

5.verse: For You are not a God who rejoices in evil. No wickedness dwells with you.

6.verse: Braggarts will not stand before your eyes. You hate all wrongdoers.

7.verse: You destroy those who speak falsehood. A person of bloodshed and deceit ADONAI detests.

8.verse: But because of your great lovingkindness, I will enter Your House. I will bow toward Your holy Temple, in awe of You.

9.verse: Lead me, ADONAI, in Your righteousness, because of my enemies. Make Your path straight before me.

10.verse: For nothing upright is in their mouth. Inside them is a ruin—their throat an open grave. They flatter with their tongue.

11.verse: Declare them guilty, O God! Let them fall by their own schemes. Banish them because of their many transgressions— for they have rebelled against You.

12.verse: But let all who take refuge in You rejoice! Let them always shout for joy! You will shelter them and they exult—those who love Your Name.

1.verse: Prayer for Mercy Psalm 6 - For the music director, on the eight-string lyre, a psalm of David.

2.verse: ADONAI, do not rebuke me in Your anger! Do not discipline me in Your wrath.

3.verse: Be gracious to me, ADONAI, for I am weak. Heal me, ADONAI—for my bones are shuddering with fear,

4.verse: as is my soul— and You, ADONAI—how long?

5.verse: Turn toward me, ADONAI, deliver my soul! Save me—because of Your mercy.

6.verse: For there is no memory of You in death, in Sheol who will praise You?

7.verse: I am worn out with my groaning. Every night I make my bed swim, drenching my pillow with my tears.

8.verse: My eyes are weakened with grief— they age because of my enemies.

9.verse: Away from me, all you evildoers! For ADONAI heard the sound of my weeping.

10.verse: ADONAI has heard my cry for mercy. ADONAI accepts my prayer:

1.verse: ADONAI Magen Psalm 7 - A passionate song of David, which he sang to ADONAI concerning Cush, a Benjamite.

2.verse: ADONAI my God, in You I have taken refuge. Save me from each of my persecutors, and deliver me.

3.verse: Otherwise he will rip me apart like a lion, with no one to rescue me.

4.verse: ADONAI my God, if I have done this— if there is guilt on my hands,

5.verse: if I have paid back evil to anyone at peace with me, or unjustly attacked my adversary,

6.verse: then let the enemy chase me, overtake me, and trample me into the ground, leaving my honor in the dirt! Selah

7.verse: Arise, ADONAI, in Your anger, arise against the fury of my enemies! Awake for me! You decreed justice.

8.verse: Let an assembly of peoples gather around You and return on high, above them.

9.verse: ADONAI judges the peoples. Vindicate me, ADONAI, according to my righteousness and integrity in me.

10.verse: Please, end the evil of the wicked and sustain the righteous. A just God examines hearts and minds.

11.verse: My shield is God— Savior of the upright in heart.

12.verse: God is a righteous judge, a God who is indignant every day.

13.verse: If He does not relent, He will sharpen His sword. He has bent His bow and made it ready.

14.verse: He prepares His own deadly weapons. He makes His fiery arrows.

15.verse: Look! The one pregnant with trouble conceives mischief and brings forth deceit.

16.verse: He digs a pit, scrapes it out, and then falls into the hole he has made.

17.verse: His mischief will turn on his own head. His violence will boomerang on his crown.

1.verse: Humanity is God’s Splendor Psalm 8 - For the music director, upon the Gittite lyre: a psalm of David.

2.verse: ADONAI our Lord, how excellent is Your Name over all the earth! You set Your splendor above the heavens.

3.verse: Out of the mouths of babies and toddlers You established power, because of Your enemies, to silence the foe and the avenger.

4.verse: When I consider Your heavens, the work of Your fingers, the moon and the stars, which You established—

5.verse: what is man, that You are mindful of him? And the son of man, that You care for him?

6.verse: Yet You made him a little lower than the angels, and crowned him with glory and majesty!

7.verse: You gave him dominion over the works of Your hands. You put all things under their feet:

8.verse: all sheep and oxen, and also beasts of the field,

9.verse: birds in the air, and fish in the ocean— all passing through the paths of the seas.

1.verse: Our Righteous Judge Psalm 9 - For the music director, to the tune of “The Death of the Son,” a psalm of David.

2.verse: I will praise ADONAI with my whole heart. I will tell about all Your wonders.

3.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in You. I will sing praise to Your Name, Elyon!

4.verse: When my enemies turn back, they stumble and perish before You.

5.verse: For You upheld my right and my cause. You sat upon the throne, judging righteously.

6.verse: You rebuked the nations, You destroyed the wicked— blotting out their name forever and ever.

7.verse: The enemy is finished, in ruins forever. You overturned their cities— even the memory of them has perished.

8.verse: But ADONAI reigns forever. He established His throne for judgment.

9.verse: He judges the world in righteousness and governs the peoples justly.

10.verse: ADONAI is a stronghold for the oppressed, a high tower in times of trouble.

11.verse: Those who know Your Name trust You— for You, ADONAI, never have forsaken those who seek You.

12.verse: Sing praises to ADONAI, who dwells in Zion. Declare His deeds among the peoples.

13.verse: He who avenges blood remembers. He will not forget the cry of the afflicted.

14.verse: Be compassionate to me, ADONAI. See my affliction from those hating me. Lift me up from the gates of death.

15.verse: Then I will tell all your praises in the gates of the daughter of Zion, rejoicing in Your salvation.

16.verse: The nations sank into the pit they made. The net they hid caught their own foot.

17.verse: ADONAI is known for executing judgment. The wicked one is trapped in the work of his own hands. Selah

18.verse: The wicked will turn to Sheol, as will all the nations that forget God.

19.verse: For the needy will not forever be forgotten, nor the hope of the poor perish forever.

20.verse: Arise, ADONAI, do not let man triumph. Let the nations be judged before You.

1.verse: Freedom from Terror Psalm 10 - Why, ADONAI, are You standing far off? Why hide Yourself in times of trouble?

2.verse: In pride the wicked hotly hunts the poor. Let them be caught in the plots they have planned.

3.verse: For the wicked one boasts about his soul’s desire. The greedy one curses, reviling ADONAI.

4.verse: The wicked one, with his nose in the air, never seeks Him. All his thoughts are: “There is no God.”

5.verse: His ways are secure at all times. He haughtily disregards Your judgments. He snorts at all his adversaries.

6.verse: He says in his heart: “I’ll never be shaken! From generation to generation nothing bad will happen.”

7.verse: His mouth is full of cursing, lies and oppression. On his tongue are trouble and iniquity.

8.verse: He lies in ambush near villages. In hidden places he slays the innocent. His eyes watch in secret for the helpless.

9.verse: He lurks in a hiding place like a lion in a thicket. He lies in wait to catch the helpless. He catches the unfortunate one, dragging him away in his net.

10.verse: The victim is crushed, brought down, and falls into his mighty claws.

11.verse: He says in his heart: “God has forgotten. He hides His face—He will never see it.”

12.verse: Arise, ADONAI! O God, lift up Your hand. Do not forget the afflicted.

13.verse: Why does the wicked one revile God? He says in his heart: “You will never require anything.”

14.verse: You saw—for You see trouble and grief, to take it in Your hand. The victim puts his trust in You— You are the helper of the orphan.

15.verse: Break the arm of the wicked, evil one! Call him to account for his wickedness— until no more is found.

16.verse: ADONAI is King forever and ever! Nations will be wiped off His land.

17.verse: You hear, ADONAI, the desire of the meek. You encourage them and incline Your ear.

18.verse: You vindicate the orphan and oppressed, so that man, who is earthly, may terrify no more.

1.verse: Judgment from Heaven Psalm 11 - For the music director, a psalm of David. In ADONAI I have taken shelter. How can you say to my soul: “Fly like a bird to your mountain?

2.verse: For look, the wicked bend the bow. They fix their arrow on the bowstring so they can shoot from the shadows at those who are upright in heart.

3.verse: If our foundations are destroyed, what should the righteous do?”

4.verse: ADONAI is in His holy Temple. ADONAI’s throne is in heaven. His eyes are watching. His eyelids observe the children of men.

5.verse: ADONAI examines the righteous. But the wicked and one loving violence His soul hates.

6.verse: On the wicked He will rain down fire, brimstone and scorching wind as the portion of their cup!

7.verse: For ADONAI is righteous—He loves justice. The upright will see His face.

1.verse: Silence the Flattering Lips Psalm 12 - For the music director, on the eight-string lyre, a psalm of David.

2.verse: Help, ADONAI! For no one godly exists. For the faithful have vanished from the children of men.

3.verse: Everyone tells a lie to his neighbor, talking with flattering lips and a divided heart.

4.verse: May ADONAI cut off all flattering lips— a tongue bragging big things.

5.verse: They say: “With our tongue we’ll prevail. We own our lips—who can master us?”

6.verse: “Because of the oppression of the poor, because of the groaning of the needy, now will I arise,” says ADONAI. “I will put him in the safe place—he pants for it.”

7.verse: The words of ADONAI are pure words— like silver refined in an earthly crucible, purified seven times.

8.verse: You will keep us safe, ADONAI. You will protect us from this generation forever.

1.verse: Trust in His Chesed Psalm 13 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: How long, ADONAI? Will You forget me forever? How long will You hide Your face from me?

3.verse: How long must I have cares in my soul and daily sorrow in my heart? How long will my enemy triumph over me?

4.verse: Look at me and answer, ADONAI my God. Light up my eyes, or I will sleep in death.

5.verse: Or else my enemy will say: “I have overcome him!” and my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.

6.verse: But I trust in Your lovingkindness, my heart rejoices in Your salvation. I will sing to ADONAI, because He has been good to me.

1.verse: There Is No God? Psalm 14 - For the music director, of David. The fool said in his heart: “There is no God.” They are corrupt; their deeds are vile; there is no one who does good.

2.verse: ADONAI looked down from heaven on the children of men, to see if there are any who understand, who seek after God.

3.verse: They all turned aside, became corrupt. There is no one who does good —not even one.

4.verse: “Will evildoers never understand— those who consume My people as they eat bread— and never call on ADONAI?”

5.verse: There they are, in great dread. For God is with the righteous generation.

6.verse: You would frustrate the plan of the lowly. Surely ADONAI is his refuge!

7.verse: O may He give Israel’s salvation out of Zion! When ADONAI restores His captive people, Jacob will rejoice, Israel will be glad!

1.verse: Walking with Integrity Psalm 15 - A psalm of David. ADONAI, who may dwell in Your tent? Who may live on Your holy mountain?

2.verse: The one who walks with integrity, who does what is right, and speaks truth in his heart,

3.verse: who does not slander with his tongue, does not wrong his neighbor, and does not disgrace his friend,

4.verse: who despises a vile person in his eyes, but honors those who fear ADONAI, who keeps his oath even when it hurts, and does not change,

5.verse: who lends his money without usury, and takes no bribe against the innocent. One who does these things will never be shaken.

1.verse: The Path of Eternal Life Psalm 16 - A Michtam of David. Keep me safe, O God, for in You I have found shelter.

2.verse: I said to ADONAI: “You are my Lord— I have no good apart from You.”

3.verse: As for the kedoshim who are in the land, they are noble—in them is all my delight.

4.verse: As for those who run after another god, may their sorrows multiply. I will not pour out their drink offerings of blood, nor lift up their names with my lips.

5.verse: ADONAI is my portion and my cup. You cast my lot.

6.verse: My boundary lines fall in pleasant places —surely my heritage is beautiful.

7.verse: I will bless ADONAI, who counsels me. Even at night my heart instructs me.

8.verse: I have set ADONAI always before me. Since He is at my right hand, I will not be shaken.

9.verse: So my heart is glad and my soul rejoices. My body also rests secure.

10.verse: For You will not abandon my soul to Sheol nor let Your faithful one see the Pit.

11.verse: You make known to me the path of life. Abundance of joys are in Your presence, eternal pleasures at Your right hand.

1.verse: A Plea for Vindication Psalm 17 - A prayer of David. Hear, ADONAI, a just plea, listen to my cry! Give ear to my prayer—from lips with no deceit.

2.verse: From Your presence comes my vindication. Your eyes see what is right.

3.verse: You have examined my heart. You searched me at night. Though You test me, You find nothing. I resolved that my mouth will not sin.

4.verse: As for the deeds of mankind— by the word of Your lips I have kept out of the ways of the violent.

5.verse: My steps have kept on Your paths. My feet have not slipped.

6.verse: I called upon You, O God, for You will answer me. Incline Your ear to me, hear my speech.

7.verse: Be wonderful with Your lovingkindness, O Savior of those taking refuge at Your right hand from those rising up against them.

8.verse: Protect me like the pupil of the eye. Hide me in the shadow of Your wings,

9.verse: from the wicked who attack me— my enemies, who surround me.

10.verse: Their callous heart they shut tight. With their mouth they speak proudly.

11.verse: Our steps are now surrounded. They set their eyes to throw us down to the ground,

12.verse: like a lion eager to tear to pieces, like a young lion crouching in cover.

13.verse: Arise, ADONAI! Confront him! Make him bow down! Deliver my soul from the wicked with Your sword,

14.verse: from men, with Your hand, ADONAI, from men of the world whose portion is in this life. You fill their belly with Your treasure —with plenty of children— and leave their surplus to their babes.

15.verse: I in righteousness will behold Your face! When I awake, I will be satisfied with Your likeness.

1.verse: ADONAI lives! Blessed Be My Rock Psalm 18 - For the music director: a psalm of David the servant of ADONAI. He chanted the words of this song to ADONAI on the day ADONAI delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul.

2.verse: He said, I love You, ADONAI my strength!

3.verse: ADONAI is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer. My God is my rock, in Him I take refuge, my shield, my horn of salvation, my stronghold.

4.verse: I called upon ADONAI, worthy of praise, and I was rescued from my enemies.

5.verse: Cords of death entangled me. Torrents of Belial overwhelmed me.

6.verse: Cords of Sheol coiled around me. Snares of death came before me.

7.verse: In my distress I called on ADONAI, and cried to my God for help. From His Temple He heard my voice, my cry before Him came into His ears.

8.verse: Then the earth rocked and quaked. The foundations of mountains trembled. They reeled because He was angry.

9.verse: Smoke rose from His nostrils and consuming fire from His mouth. Coals blazed from Him.

10.verse: He parted the heavens and came down, with thick darkness under His feet.

11.verse: He rode upon a cheruv and flew. He soared on the wings of the wind.

12.verse: He made darkness His cover, His sukkah all around Him— dark waters, thick clouds.

13.verse: Out of the brilliance before Him passed His thick clouds, hail and fiery coals.

14.verse: ADONAI also thundered in the heavens, and Elyon gave forth His voice, hail and fiery coals.

15.verse: He shot His arrows and scattered them, hurled lightning bolts and routed them.

16.verse: Then ravines of water appeared. The foundations of earth were exposed, at Your rebuke, ADONAI, at a blast of breath from Your nostrils.

17.verse: He reached down from on high and took hold of me. He drew me out of mighty waters.

18.verse: He saved me from my powerful enemy, from those who hated me— for they were much stronger than me.

19.verse: They came against me in my day of calamity, but ADONAI was my support.

20.verse: He brought me out to a wide-open place. He rescued me since He delighted in me.

21.verse: ADONAI rewarded me for my righteousness. For the cleanness of my hands He repaid me.

22.verse: For I kept the ways of ADONAI, and did not turn wickedly from my God.

23.verse: For all His judgments are before me. I do not put His rulings away from me.

24.verse: I also had integrity with Him, and kept myself from my sin.

25.verse: So ADONAI rewarded me for my righteousness, for the cleanness of my hands in His eyes.

26.verse: With the loyal You deal loyally. With the blameless You are blameless.

27.verse: With the pure You are pure, and with the crooked You are shrewd.

28.verse: For You save lowly people, but haughty eyes You humble.

29.verse: For You light up my lamp. ADONAI my God shines in my darkness.

30.verse: For with You I rush on a troop, with my God I scale a wall.

31.verse: As for God, His way is perfect. The word of ADONAI is pure. He is a shield to all who take refuge in Him.

32.verse: For who is God, except ADONAI? And who is a Rock, except our God?

33.verse: God girds me with strength and makes my way straight.

34.verse: He makes my feet like those of deer and makes me stand on my heights.

35.verse: He trains my hands for battle, so my arms can bend a bronze bow.

36.verse: You gave me the shield of Your salvation. Your right hand upholds me, Your gentleness makes me great.

37.verse: You broaden my steps beneath me, so my ankles have not slipped.

38.verse: I pursue my enemies and overtake them, and will not return till they are wiped out.

39.verse: I will crush them till they cannot rise, till they fall beneath my feet.

40.verse: For You girded me with strength for battle. You made those who rose up against me bow down before me.

41.verse: You also made my enemies turn their backs to me. I cut off those who hate me.

42.verse: They cry out, but there is none to save —even to ADONAI, but He did not answer them.

43.verse: Then I beat them as fine as dust before the wind. I pour them out like mud in the streets.

44.verse: You free me from strifes of the people. You set me as head of the nations— people I did not know are serving me.

45.verse: As soon as they hear, they obey me. Children of foreigners cringe before me.

46.verse: Children of foreigners lose heart and come trembling from their hideouts.

47.verse: ADONAI lives! And blessed be my Rock! Exalted be God my salvation!

48.verse: God—He gives me vengeance and subdues peoples under me.

49.verse: He delivers me from my enemies. Indeed You lift me up above those who rise up against me. You deliver me from the violent man.

50.verse: Therefore I praise You among the nations, ADONAI, and sing praises to Your Name.

1.verse: Glory from Heaven and Torah Psalm 19 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the sky shows His handiwork.

3.verse: Day to day they speak, night to night they reveal knowledge.

4.verse: There is no speech, no words, where their voice goes unheard.

5.verse: Their voice has gone out to all the earth and their words to the end of the world. In the heavens He pitched a tent for the sun.

6.verse: It is like a bridegroom coming out of his bridal chamber. It is like a strong man rejoicing to run his course.

7.verse: It rises at one end of the heavens and makes its circuit to the other end. Nothing is hidden from its heat.

8.verse: The Torah of ADONAI is perfect, restoring the soul. The testimony of ADONAI is trustworthy, making the simple wise.

9.verse: The precepts of ADONAI are right, giving joy to the heart. The mitzvot of ADONAI are pure, giving light to the eyes.

10.verse: The fear of ADONAI is clean, enduring forever. The judgments of ADONAI are true and altogether righteous.

11.verse: They are more desirable than gold, yes, more than much pure gold! They are sweeter than honey and drippings of the honeycomb.

12.verse: Moreover by them Your servant is warned. In keeping them there is great reward.

13.verse: Who can discern his errors? Cleanse me of hidden faults.

14.verse: Also keep Your servant from willful sins. May they not have dominion over me. Then I will be blameless, free from great transgression.

1.verse: ADONAI-Nissi Psalm 20 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: May ADONAI answer you in the day of trouble! May the Name of the God of Jacob set you up securely on high.

3.verse: May He send you help from the Sanctuary and support you from Zion.

4.verse: May He remember all your meal offerings and accept the fat of your burnt offering. Selah

5.verse: May He grant you your heart’s desire and fulfill all your plans.

6.verse: We will shout for joy in your victory and lift up our banners in the Name of our God! May ADONAI fulfill all your petitions.

7.verse: Now I know that ADONAI saves His anointed. He answers him from His holy heaven with saving strength of His right hand.

8.verse: Some have chariots, some have horses, but we remember the Name of ADONAI our God.

9.verse: They have collapsed and fallen, but we rise up and support each other.

1.verse: The Victorious King Psalm 21 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: ADONAI, the king rejoices in Your strength! How greatly he delights in Your salvation.

3.verse: You granted him his heart’s desire, and You did not withhold the request of his lips. Selah

4.verse: For You met him with the best blessings. You set on his head a crown of pure gold.

5.verse: He asked You for life, You gave it to him, length of days forever and ever.

6.verse: His glory is great through Your salvation. Honor and majesty You bestow on him.

7.verse: For You bestow on him eternal blessings, gladden him with joy in Your presence.

8.verse: For the king trusts in ADONAI, and in the lovingkindness of Elyon he will not be shaken.

9.verse: Your hand will find all your enemies. Your right hand will overtake those who hate You.

10.verse: You will make them like a fiery furnace at the time of your appearing. In His wrath ADONAI will swallow them up and fire will consume them.

11.verse: You destroy their offspring from earth, their seed from the children of men.

12.verse: Though they intended evil against You and devised a plot, they cannot succeed.

13.verse: For You make them turn their backs. You aim Your bowstrings at their faces.

1.verse: Suffering Servant Psalm 22 - For the music director, on “The Doe of the Dawn,” a psalm of David.

2.verse: My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Distant from my salvation are the words of my groaning.

3.verse: O my God, I cried out by day, but You did not answer, by night, but there was no rest for me.

4.verse: Yet You are holy, enthroned on the praises of Israel.

5.verse: In You our fathers put their trust. They trusted, and You delivered them.

6.verse: They cried to you and were delivered. In You they trusted, and were not disappointed.

7.verse: Am I a worm, and not a man? Am I a scorn of men, despised by people?

8.verse: All who see me mock me. They curl their lips, shaking their heads:

9.verse: “Rely on ADONAI! Let Him deliver him! Let Him rescue him—since he delights in Him!”

10.verse: Yet You brought me out of the womb, made me secure at my mother’s breasts.

11.verse: From the womb I was cast on You— from my mother’s womb You have been my God.

12.verse: Be not far from me! For trouble is near— there is no one to help.

13.verse: Many bulls have surrounded me. Strong bulls of Bashan encircled me.

14.verse: They open wide their mouths against me, like a tearing, roaring lion.

15.verse: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are disjointed. My heart is like wax— melting within my innards.

16.verse: My strength is dried up like a clay pot, my tongue clings to my jaws. You lay me in the dust of death.

17.verse: For dogs have surrounded me. A band of evildoers has closed in on me. They pierced my hands and my feet.

18.verse: I can count all my bones. They stare, they gape at me.

19.verse: They divide my clothes among them, and cast lots for my garment.

20.verse: But You, ADONAI, be not far off! O my strength! Come quickly to my aid!

21.verse: Deliver my soul from the sword— my only one from the power of the dog.

22.verse: Save me from the lion’s mouth. From the horns of the wild oxen rescue me.

23.verse: I will declare Your Name to my brothers. I will praise You amid the congregation.

24.verse: You who fear ADONAI, praise Him! All Jacob’s descendants, glorify Him! Revere Him, all you seed of Israel.

25.verse: For He has not despised or disdained the suffering of the lowly one. Nor has He hidden His face from him, but when he cried to Him, He heard.

26.verse: From You is my praise in the great assembly. I will fulfill my vows before those who fear Him.

27.verse: Let the poor eat and be satisfied. Let them who seek after Him praise ADONAI. May your hearts live forever!

28.verse: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to ADONAI. All the families of the nations will bow down before You.

29.verse: For the kingdom belongs to ADONAI, and He rules over the nations.

30.verse: All the rich of the earth will feast and worship. Everyone who goes down to the dust will kneel before Him— even the one who could not keep his own soul alive.

31.verse: His posterity will serve him, telling the next generation about my Lord.

1.verse: ADONAI-Ro-eh Psalm 23 - A psalm of David. ADONAI is my shepherd, I shall not want.

2.verse: He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters.

3.verse: He restores my soul. He guides me in paths of righteousness for His Name’s sake.

4.verse: Even though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me: Your rod and Your staff comfort me.

5.verse: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You have anointed my head with oil, my cup overflows.

6.verse: Surely goodness and mercy will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the House of ADONAI forever.

1.verse: The King of Glory Psalm 24 - A psalm of David. The earth is ADONAI’s and all that fills it— the world, and those dwelling on it.

2.verse: For He founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the rivers.

3.verse: Who may go up on the mountain of ADONAI? Who may stand in His holy place?

4.verse: One with clean hands and a pure heart, who has not lifted his soul in vain, nor sworn deceitfully.

5.verse: He will receive a blessing from ADONAI, righteousness from God his salvation.

6.verse: Such is the generation seeking Him, seeking Your face, even Jacob! Selah

7.verse: Lift up your heads, O gates, and be lifted up, you everlasting doors: that the King of glory may come in.

8.verse: “Who is this King of glory?” ADONAI strong and mighty, ADONAI mighty in battle!

9.verse: Lift up your heads, O gates, and lift them up, you everlasting doors: that the King of glory may come in.

10.verse: “Who is this King of glory?” ADONAI-Tzva’ot—He is the King of glory! Selah

1.verse: Teach Me Your Paths Psalm 25 - Of David. To You, ADONAI, I lift up my soul.

2.verse: O my God, in You I trust, so I will not be ashamed, and my enemies will not gloat over me.

3.verse: Surely no one who waits for You will be ashamed. But the treacherous without cause will be ashamed.

4.verse: Show me Your ways, ADONAI. Teach me Your paths.

5.verse: Guide me in Your truth, and teach me, for You are God, my salvation, for You I wait all day.

6.verse: Remember, ADONAI, Your compassions and Your mercies— for they are from eternity.

7.verse: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my rebellion. According to Your mercy remember me, for the sake of Your goodness, ADONAI.

8.verse: Good and upright is ADONAI. Therefore He directs sinners in the way.

9.verse: He guides the humble in what is right, and teaches the humble His way.

10.verse: All ADONAI’s ways are lovingkindness and truth to those who keep His covenant and His testimonies.

11.verse: For Your Name’s sake, ADONAI, pardon my guilt, for it is great.

12.verse: Who is this man who fears ADONAI? He will instruct him in the way he should choose.

13.verse: His soul abides in goodness, and his offspring will inherit the land.

14.verse: The secret of ADONAI is for those who fear Him. He makes His covenant known to them.

15.verse: My eyes are always looking to ADONAI, for He will pull my feet out of the net.

16.verse: Turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am lonely and afflicted.

17.verse: The troubles of my heart increase. Bring me out of my distress.

18.verse: See my affliction and my suffering, and take away all my sins.

19.verse: See my enemies, how many they are— they hate me with violent hatred.

20.verse: Guard my soul and deliver me. Let me not be ashamed, for I take refuge in You.

21.verse: May integrity and uprightness protect me— for I wait for You.

22.verse: Redeem Israel, O God, from all their troubles.

1.verse: Walking with Integrity Psalm 26 - Of David. Vindicate me, ADONAI, for I have walked in my integrity, and trusted in ADONAI without wavering.

2.verse: Probe me, ADONAI, and test me, refine my mind and my heart.

3.verse: For Your love is before my eyes and I have walked in Your truth.

4.verse: I have not sat with men of falsehood, nor do I consort with hypocrites.

5.verse: I detest the company of evildoers, and do not sit with the wicked.

6.verse: I will wash my hands in innocence, so I can walk around Your altar, ADONAI,

7.verse: hearing the voice of thanksgiving while proclaiming all Your wonders.

8.verse: ADONAI, I love the House where You live, the place where Your glory dwells.

9.verse: Do not take my soul away with sinners, nor my life with people of bloodshed—

10.verse: in whose hands are wicked schemes, whose right hand is full of bribes.

11.verse: But I—I will walk in my integrity. Redeem me and be gracious to me.

12.verse: My feet stand on level ground. In congregations I will bless ADONAI.

1.verse: Let Your Heart Take Courage Psalm 27 - Of David. ADONAI is my light and my salvation: whom should I fear? ADONAI is the stronghold of my life: whom should I dread?

2.verse: When evildoers approached me to devour my flesh —my adversaries and my foes—they stumbled and fell.

3.verse: Though an army camp besieges me, my heart will not fear. Though war breaks out against me, even then will I be confident.

4.verse: One thing have I asked of ADONAI, that will I seek: to dwell in the House of ADONAI all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of ADONAI, and to meditate in His Temple.

5.verse: For in the day of trouble He will hide me in His sukkah, conceal me in the shelter of His tent, and set me high upon a rock.

6.verse: Then will my head be high above my enemies around me. In His Tabernacle I will offer sacrifices with shouts of joy. I will sing, yes, sing praises to ADONAI.

7.verse: Hear, ADONAI, when I call with my voice, be gracious to me and answer me.

8.verse: To You my heart says: “Seek My face.” Your face, ADONAI, I seek.

9.verse: Do not hide Your face from me. Do not turn Your servant away in anger. You have been my help. Do not abandon me or forsake me, O God my salvation.

10.verse: Though my father and my mother forsake me, ADONAI will take me in.

11.verse: Teach me Your way, ADONAI, and lead me on a level path— because of my enemies.

12.verse: Do not turn me over to the desire of my foes. For false witnesses rise up against me, breathing out violence.

13.verse: Surely I trust that I will see the goodness of ADONAI in the land of the living.

14.verse: Wait for ADONAI. Be strong, let Your heart take courage, and wait for ADONAI.

1.verse: Hoshia-na! Psalm 28 - Of David. To You, ADONAI, I call— my Rock, do not be deaf to me. If You were silent to me, I would become like those going down to the Pit.

2.verse: Hear the sound of my pleas, when I cry to You for help, when I lift up my hands toward Your holy Sanctuary.

3.verse: Do not drag me away with the wicked and with doers of iniquity, who speak peace with their neighbors, while evil is in their hearts.

4.verse: Repay them for their deeds, their evil acts. Repay them for the deeds of their hands. Bring back on them what they deserve.

5.verse: Since they show no regard for the deeds of ADONAI nor the work of His hands, He will tear them down and never build them up.

6.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, because He has heard the sound of my supplications.

7.verse: ADONAI is my strength and my shield. My heart trusts in Him, and I was helped. Therefore my heart leaps for joy, and I will praise Him with my song.

8.verse: ADONAI is their strength— a stronghold of salvation for His anointed.

9.verse: Save Your people, bless Your inheritance, shepherd them and carry them forever.

1.verse: God Thunders Throughout Creation Psalm 29 - A psalm of David. Ascribe to ADONAI, O sons of God, ascribe to ADONAI glory and strength.

2.verse: Ascribe to ADONAI the glory of His Name. Bow down to ADONAI in the beauty of holiness.

3.verse: The voice of ADONAI is over the waters. The God of glory thunders— ADONAI is over mighty waters.

4.verse: The voice of ADONAI is powerful. The voice of ADONAI is full of majesty.

5.verse: The voice of ADONAI breaks the cedars. Yes, ADONAI shatters cedars of Lebanon.

6.verse: He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, Sirion like a young wild ox.

7.verse: The voice of ADONAI hews out flames of fire.

8.verse: The voice of ADONAI shakes the desert. ADONAI shakes the wilderness of Kadesh.

9.verse: The voice of ADONAI makes the deer writhe in birth and strips forests bare, and in His Temple all are saying, “Glory!”

10.verse: ADONAI sits enthroned over the flood. Yes, ADONAI sits as King forever.

11.verse: ADONAI gives strength to His people. ADONAI blesses His people with shalom.

1.verse: Joy Comes in the Morning Psalm 30 - A psalm, a song for the dedication of the Temple, of David.

2.verse: I will exalt You, ADONAI, for You have lifted me up, and did not let my enemies gloat over me.

3.verse: ADONAI my God, I cried to You for help, and You healed me.

4.verse: ADONAI, You brought my soul up from Sheol. You kept me alive, so I would not go down to the Pit.

5.verse: Sing praise to ADONAI, His faithful ones, and praise His holy name.

6.verse: For His anger lasts for only a moment, His favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may stay for the night, but joy comes in the morning.

7.verse: When I felt secure, I said: “I will never be shaken.”

8.verse: ADONAI, in Your favor You made my mountain stand strong. When You hid Your face, I was terrified.

9.verse: To You, ADONAI, I called, and to my Lord I made my plea:

10.verse: “What gain is there in my blood, in my going down to the Pit? Will the dust praise You? Will it declare Your truth?

11.verse: Hear, ADONAI, and be gracious to me. ADONAI, be my help.”

12.verse: You turned my mourning into dancing. You removed my sackcloth and clothed me with joy.

1.verse: Refuge, Sukkah, Shelter Psalm 31 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: In You, ADONAI, have I taken refuge: Let me never be put to shame. In Your righteousness, deliver me.

3.verse: Turn Your ear to me, rescue me quickly. Be a rock of refuge for me, a stronghold for my deliverance.

4.verse: Since You are my rock and my fortress, You lead me and guide me for Your Name’s sake.

5.verse: Free me from the net they hid for me, for You are my refuge.

6.verse: Into Your hand I commit my spirit. You have redeemed me, ADONAI, God of truth.

7.verse: I detest those who continue to watch worthless idols, but I trust in ADONAI.

8.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in Your lovingkindness, for You saw my affliction. You knew the troubles of my soul.

9.verse: You did not hand me over to the enemy. You set my feet in a wide-open place.

10.verse: Be gracious to me, ADONAI, for I am in distress. My eyes waste away with grief, my soul and my body as well.

11.verse: For my life is consumed in sorrow and my years in sighing. My strength fails because of my anguish and my bones waste away.

12.verse: Because of all my adversaries I am the contempt of my neighbors and a dread to my acquaintances. Seeing me on the street, they flee from me.

13.verse: I am as forgotten as a dead man. I have become like a broken vessel.

14.verse: For I have heard the whispering of many. There is terror on every side as they conspire against me and plot to take my life.

15.verse: But I have trusted in You, ADONAI. I said: “You are my God.”

16.verse: My times are in Your hands. Deliver me from the hands of my foes and from those who pursue me.

17.verse: Make Your face shine on Your servant. Save me in Your lovingkindness.

18.verse: ADONAI, let me not be ashamed, for I have called upon You. Let the wicked be ashamed— let them be silent in Sheol.

19.verse: Let the lying lips be mute. For they speak arrogantly against the righteous, with pride and contempt.

20.verse: How great is Your goodness, which You have stored up for those who fear You, which You have given to those who take refuge in You, before the children of men.

21.verse: In the shelter of Your presence You hide them from people’s plots. You conceal them in a sukkah from the strife of tongues.

22.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, for He has shown me His wonderful love in a besieged city.

23.verse: I said in my alarm, “I have been cut off from Your sight!” But You heard the sound of my pleas when I cried out to You.

24.verse: Love ADONAI, all His kedoshim! ADONAI preserves all the faithful, but the proud He pays back in full.

1.verse: Confess, Return and Learn Psalm 32 - Of David, a contemplative song. Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is pardoned.

2.verse: Blessed is the one whose guilt ADONAI does not count, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.

3.verse: When I kept silent, my bones became brittle through my groaning all day long.

4.verse: For day and night Your hand was heavy upon me. My strength was drained as in the droughts of summer. Selah

5.verse: Then I acknowledged my sin to You and did not hide my iniquity. I said: “I confess my transgressions to ADONAI,” and You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah

6.verse: So let everyone who is godly pray to You in a time when You may be found. When great floodwaters rise, they will not reach him.

7.verse: You are my hiding place— You will protect me from distress. You surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah

8.verse: “I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. I will give counsel—My eye is on you.

9.verse: Do not be like the horse or the mule, which have no understanding, and must be held in with bit and bridle or they will not come to you.”

10.verse: Many are the sorrows of the wicked, but lovingkindness surrounds the one who trusts in ADONAI.

11.verse: Be glad in ADONAI and rejoice, you righteous, and shout for joy, all who are upright in heart.

1.verse: All Creation Praise the Creator Psalm 33 - Sing for joy to ADONAI, you righteous. Praise is fitting for the upright.

2.verse: Praise ADONAI with the harp. Sing praises to Him with a ten string lyre.

3.verse: Sing to Him a new song! Play skillfully amid shouts of joy.

4.verse: For the word of ADONAI is upright and all His work is done in faithfulness.

5.verse: He loves righteousness and justice. The earth is full of the love of ADONAI.

6.verse: By ADONAI’s word were the heavens made, and all their host by the breath of His mouth.

7.verse: He gathers the waters of the sea together in a heap. He lays up deep waters in storehouses.

8.verse: Let all the earth fear ADONAI. Let all the inhabitants of the world stand in awe of Him.

9.verse: For He spoke, and it came to be. He commanded, and it stood firm.

10.verse: ADONAI foils the purpose of the nations. He thwarts the plans of the peoples.

11.verse: The plan of ADONAI stands forever, the purposes of His heart from generation to generation.

12.verse: Blessed is the nation whose God is ADONAI, the people He chose for His own inheritance.

13.verse: ADONAI looks down from heaven. He observes all humanity.

14.verse: From His dwelling place He gazes on all the inhabitants of the earth—

15.verse: He who fashions the hearts of all, who discerns all their deeds.

16.verse: No king is saved by his great army, no warrior is delivered by great strength.

17.verse: A horse is a false hope for victory, nor can its great strength save.

18.verse: Behold, the eyes of ADONAI are on those who fear Him, waiting for His love,

19.verse: to deliver their souls from death, and to keep them alive in famine.

20.verse: Our soul waits for ADONAI— He is our help and our shield.

21.verse: Our heart rejoices in Him, because we trusted in His holy Name.

22.verse: Let Your lovingkindness, ADONAI, be upon us, as we have waited for You.

1.verse: Taste and See Psalm 34 - Of David, when he feigned insanity before Abimelech, who drove him away, and he left.

2.verse: I will bless ADONAI at all times. His praise is continually in my mouth.

3.verse: My soul boasts in ADONAI. The humble ones hear of it and rejoice.

4.verse: Magnify ADONAI with me and let us exalt His Name together.

5.verse: I sought ADONAI, and He answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.

6.verse: They who looked to Him were radiant, and their faces will never be ashamed.

7.verse: This poor man cried, and ADONAI heard, and saved him out of all his troubles.

8.verse: The angel of ADONAI encamps around those who fear Him, and delivers them.

9.verse: Taste and see how good ADONAI is. Blessed is the one who takes refuge in Him.

10.verse: Fear ADONAI, His kedoshim, For those who fear Him lack nothing.

11.verse: Young lions may lack, and go hungry, but those who seek ADONAI want for no good thing.

12.verse: Come, children, listen to me: I will teach you the fear of ADONAI.

13.verse: Who is the one who delights in life, and loves to see good days?

14.verse: Keep your tongue from evil, and your lips from speaking treachery.

15.verse: Depart from evil and do good. Seek shalom and pursue it.

16.verse: The eyes of ADONAI are on the righteous, and His ears are attentive to their cry.

17.verse: The face of ADONAI is against evildoers, to cut off the memory of them from the earth.

18.verse: The righteous cry out and ADONAI hears, and delivers them from all their troubles.

19.verse: ADONAI is close to the brokenhearted, and saves those crushed in spirit.

20.verse: Many are the distresses of the righteous, but ADONAI delivers him out of them all.

21.verse: He keeps all his bones— not one of them is broken.

22.verse: Evil kills the wicked— those who hate the righteous will be held guilty.

1.verse: Justice for the Oppressed Psalm 35 - A psalm of David. ADONAI, oppose those who oppose me. Fight those who fight me.

2.verse: Take hold of shield and buckler, and rise up to my help.

3.verse: Draw out also a spear and battle-axe. Stop those who pursue me. Say to my soul: “I am your salvation.”

4.verse: May those who seek my life be ashamed and disgraced. May they be turned back and humiliated —those who plot evil against me.

5.verse: May they be like chaff before the wind, with the angel of ADONAI driving them off.

6.verse: May their way be dark and slippery, with the angel of ADONAI pursuing them.

7.verse: For without cause they hid their net for me, and without cause they dug a pit for my soul.

8.verse: Let ruin come upon him by surprise. Let the net he hid entangle himself —into that same pit let him fall.

9.verse: Then my soul will rejoice in ADONAI and delight in His salvation.

10.verse: All my bones will say: “ADONAI, who is like You, rescuing the poor from one too strong for him, the poor and needy from one who robs him?”

11.verse: Violent witnesses rise up. They question me about things I know nothing about.

12.verse: They repay me evil for good— my soul is forlorn.

13.verse: But as for me, when they were sick, my clothing was sackcloth. I afflicted my soul with fasting, my prayer kept returning to my heart.

14.verse: I went about mourning as though for my own friend or brother. I bowed down dressed in black as though for my own mother.

15.verse: But at my stumbling they gathered in glee. Wretches gathered against me whom I did not know, tearing at me without ceasing.

16.verse: They mocked profanely, as if at a feast, they gnashed at me with their teeth.

17.verse: My Lord, how long will You look on? Rescue my soul from their ravages— my solitary existence from the lions.

18.verse: I praise You in the great assembly, acclaiming You among a throng of people.

19.verse: Do not let my deceitful enemies gloat over me without cause, nor let those who hate me for nothing wink an eye.

20.verse: For they never speak shalom, but devise deceitful words against the quiet ones in the land.

21.verse: Yes, they open their mouth wide against me, saying: “Aha! Aha! Our own eyes have seen it!”

22.verse: You have seen it, ADONAI—be not silent! ADONAI, be not far from me.

23.verse: Arise, awaken to my defense, to my cause—my God and my Lord!

24.verse: Vindicate me, ADONAI my God, according to Your justice, and do not let them gloat over me.

25.verse: Don’t let them say in their heart: “Aha! Just what we wanted!” Don’t let them say: “We swallowed him up!”

26.verse: May they be ashamed and humiliated, those who rejoice over my misery. May they who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and disgrace.

27.verse: May they shout for joy and be glad, those who delight in my righteous cause. May they always say: “Exalted be ADONAI, who delights in His servant’s shalom.”

28.verse: Then my tongue will declare aloud Your justice and Your praises all day.

1.verse: With God Is the Fountain of Life Psalm 36 - For the music director, of David the servant of ADONAI.

2.verse: An oracle of Transgression—within my heart, to the wicked one: “There is no fear of God before his eyes.

3.verse: For he flatters himself in his own eyes, too much to notice his iniquity—or hate it.

4.verse: His mouth’s words are iniquity and deceit. He has ceased to be wise and do good.

5.verse: Even on his bed he plans sin. He puts himself on a path that is no good, never refusing evil.”

6.verse: Your love, ADONAI, is in the heavens, Your faithfulness up to the skies.

7.verse: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God. Your judgments are like the great deep. You preserve man and beast, ADONAI.

8.verse: How precious is Your love, O God! The children of men find refuge in the shadow of Your wings.

9.verse: They drink their fill from the abundance of Your House. You give them drink from the river of Your delights.

10.verse: For with You is the fountain of life— in Your light we see light.

11.verse: Continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, and Your justice to the upright in heart.

12.verse: May the foot of pride never tread on me, nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.

1.verse: Inheritance of the Kedoshim Psalm 37 - Of David. Do not fret because of evildoers, nor be envious of them who do wrong.

2.verse: For like the grass they soon wither and fade like a green herb.

3.verse: Trust in ADONAI and do good. Dwell in the land, feed on faithfulness.

4.verse: Delight yourself in ADONAI, and He will give you the requests of your heart.

5.verse: Commit your way to ADONAI. Trust in Him, and He will do it.

6.verse: He will bring out your vindication as light, and your cause will shine as noonday.

7.verse: Be still before ADONAI and wait patiently for Him. Do not fret over one prospering in his way, over one carrying out wicked schemes.

8.verse: Put away anger and turn from wrath. Do not fret—it only leads to doing evil.

9.verse: For evildoers will be cut off, but those who wait for ADONAI— they will inherit the land.

10.verse: Yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more. Yes, you will look at his place, but he will not be there.

11.verse: But the meek will inherit the land, and delight in abundant shalom.

12.verse: The wicked plots against the righteous and gnashes at him with his teeth.

13.verse: The Lord laughs at him— for He sees his day is coming.

14.verse: The wicked have unsheathed their sword and have bent their bow to bring down the poor and needy, to slay those whose conduct is upright.

15.verse: Their sword will pierce their own hearts, and their bows will be broken.

16.verse: Better a little that the righteous have than the wealth of many wicked.

17.verse: For the arms of the wicked will be broken, while ADONAI upholds the righteous.

18.verse: ADONAI knows the days of the blameless— their inheritance endures forever.

19.verse: They will not be ashamed in an evil time and in days of famine they will be satisfied.

20.verse: For the wicked will perish, and the enemies of ADONAI will be like the beauty of the fields— they will vanish—vanish like smoke.

21.verse: The wicked borrows and does not repay, but the righteous is a gracious giver.

22.verse: For His blessed ones inherit the land. But those He curses will be cut off.

23.verse: From ADONAI a man’s steps are made firm, when He delights in his way.

24.verse: Though he stumble, he will not fall headlong, for ADONAI is holding his hand.

25.verse: I was young and now I am old, yet I have never seen the righteous one forsaken, nor his children begging for bread.

26.verse: All day long he is gracious and lends. So his offspring will be a blessing.

27.verse: Turn from evil and do good, so you may live forever.

28.verse: For ADONAI loves justice and does not abandon His godly ones. They will be preserved forever, but the seed of the wicked will be cut off.

29.verse: The righteous will inherit the land and dwell in it forever.

30.verse: The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom and his tongue speaks justice.

31.verse: The Torah of his God is in his heart. His steps do not slip.

32.verse: The wicked lies in wait for the righteous, seeking to slay him.

33.verse: But ADONAI will not leave him in his hand, or let him be condemned when judged.

34.verse: Wait for ADONAI and keep His way, and He will exalt you to inherit the land. When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.

35.verse: I have seen a wicked, ruthless man flourishing like a leafy tree in native soil.

36.verse: But once he passed by, he was no more. Though I looked for him, he could not be found.

37.verse: Notice the man of integrity and watch the upright— for the man of shalom has a future.

38.verse: But transgressors will be destroyed altogether. The future of the wicked will be cut off.

39.verse: Yet the salvation of the righteous is from ADONAI. He is their stronghold in time of trouble.

40.verse: ADONAI helps them and delivers them. He rescues them from the wicked and saves them— because they take refuge in Him.

1.verse: A Burden Too Heavy for Me Psalm 38 - A psalm of David, for a memorial.

2.verse: ADONAI, do not rebuke me in Your anger or discipline me in Your wrath.

3.verse: For Your arrows have sunk deep into me and Your hand has pressed down on me.

4.verse: There is no health in my flesh because of Your indignation. There is no wholeness in my bones because of my sin.

5.verse: For my iniquities are on my head— like a burden too heavy for me.

6.verse: My wounds are foul and festering because of my foolishness.

7.verse: I am bent over, bowed down greatly. All day I walk about in mourning.

8.verse: For my heart is filled with burning pain, and there is no health in my body.

9.verse: I am numb and utterly crushed. I groan because of anguish in my heart.

10.verse: My Lord, all my longing is before You, and my sighing is not hidden from You.

11.verse: My heart pounds, my strength fails me. The light of my eyes—also, not with me.

12.verse: My friends and my companions stay away from my wound, and my kinsmen stand far off.

13.verse: They who seek my life set traps. Those who seek my hurt threaten destruction, uttering lies all day.

14.verse: But I, like someone deaf, hear nothing, like a mute, not opening his mouth.

15.verse: Yes, I am like one who cannot hear, whose mouth has no arguments.

16.verse: But I wait for You, ADONAI— You will answer, O Lord my God.

17.verse: For I said: “Don’t let them gloat over me or exalt themselves over me, when my foot slips.”

18.verse: For I am about to fall, and my pain is before me constantly.

19.verse: So I confess my guilt. I am troubled because of my sin.

20.verse: My lively enemies are numerous. Many hate me wrongfully.

21.verse: Those who repay evil for good oppose me because I pursue what is good.

22.verse: Do not forsake me, ADONAI. O my God, be not far from me.

1.verse: Make Me Know the Number of My Days Psalm 39 - For the music director, for Jeduthun, a psalm of David.

2.verse: I said: “I will guard my ways, so I will not sin with my tongue. I will muzzle my mouth while the wicked are before me.”

3.verse: So I became utterly speechless, kept silent even from good, but my anguish was stirred up.

4.verse: My heart was hot within me, while I was musing, the fire burned. Then I spoke with my tongue:

5.verse: “Let me know, ADONAI, my end and what the number of my days is. Let me know how short-lived I am.

6.verse: Behold, You made my days mere hand-breadths, and my lifetime as nothing before You. Surely all humanity is but vapor. Selah

7.verse: Everyone goes about as a mere phantom. Surely they are making an uproar in vain, heaping up stuff— yet not knowing who will gather it.

8.verse: And now, my Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in You.

9.verse: Deliver me from all my transgressions. Do not make me the scorn of a fool.

10.verse: I am speechless, not opening my mouth —for You have done it.

11.verse: Remove Your scourge from me. I perish by the blow of Your hand.

12.verse: With rebukes You chasten one for iniquity and You consume like a moth what he finds pleasure in. Surely all humanity is but a vapor. Selah

13.verse: Hear my prayer, ADONAI, and listen to my cry— do not keep silent at my tears. For with You I am an outsider, a sojourner, as all my fathers were.

1.verse: Written About Me in the Scroll Psalm 40 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: I waited patiently for ADONAI. He bent down to me and heard my cry.

3.verse: He brought me up out of the slimy pit, out of the mud and mire. Then He set my feet on a rock. He made my steps firm.

4.verse: He put a new song in my mouth— a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear, and trust in ADONAI.

5.verse: Blessed is the one who put his confidence in ADONAI, who has not turned to the arrogant, nor to those who fall into falsehood.

6.verse: Many things You have done, ADONAI my God —Your plans for us are wonderful— there is none to be compared to You! If I were to speak and tell of them, they would be too many to count!

7.verse: Sacrifice and offering You did not desire —my ears You have opened— burnt offering and sin offering You did not require.

8.verse: Then I said: “Here I am, I have come— in the scroll of a book it is written about me.

9.verse: I delight to do Your will, O my God. Yes, Your Torah is within my being.”

10.verse: I proclaim good news of righteousness in the great assembly. Behold, I am not shutting my lips— ADONAI, You know!

11.verse: I did not hide Your righteousness within my heart. Rather I declared Your faithfulness and Your salvation. I did not conceal Your lovingkindness and Your truth from the great assembly.

12.verse: ADONAI, do not withhold Your compassions from me. Let Your mercy and Your truth always protect me.

13.verse: For evils beyond number surround me, my sins have overtaken me —I cannot see— they are more than the hairs of my head —and my heart fails me.

14.verse: ADONAI, please deliver me! ADONAI, come quickly to help me!

15.verse: Let those who seek my life to sweep it away be put to shame and humiliated. Let those who wish me evil be turned back in disgrace.

16.verse: Let those who say to me, “Aha! Aha!” be appalled over their own shame.

17.verse: Let all those who seek You rejoice and be glad in You. Let those who love Your salvation continually say: “ADONAI be magnified!”

1.verse: Even My Close Friend Psalm 41 - For the music director: a psalm of David.

2.verse: Blessed is the one who considers the wretched— ADONAI will deliver him in the evil day.

3.verse: ADONAI will protect him and keep him alive. He will be made blessed in the land. You will not give him over to the desire of his foes.

4.verse: ADONAI will strengthen him on his sickbed. May You restore him completely from his bed.

5.verse: I said: “ADONAI, have mercy on me. Heal my soul, for I have sinned against You.”

6.verse: My enemies speak evil about me: “When will he die and his name perish?”

7.verse: And if someone of them comes to see me, he speaks falsely. He stores up evil in his heart, then he goes out and chatters.

8.verse: All who hate me whisper together about me They imagine the worst about me:

9.verse: “Something evil was poured into him— he will not get up again from the place where he lies.”

10.verse: Even my own close friend, whom I trusted, who ate my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.

11.verse: But You, ADONAI, have mercy on me, and raise me up, so I may repay them.

12.verse: By this I know that You delight in me: that my enemy does not shout in triumph over me.

13.verse: You uphold me in my integrity and set me before Your face forever.

1.verse: My Soul Thirsts for God Psalm 42 - For the music director, a contemplative song of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul pants for You, O God.

3.verse: My soul thirsts for God, for the living God. When will I come and appear before God?

4.verse: My tears have been my food day and night, while they say to me all day: “Where is your God?”

5.verse: These things I remember as I pour out my soul within me. For I used to go along with the throng, walking with them to the House of God, with a voice of joy and praise, a multitude keeping a festival.

6.verse: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why are you murmuring within me? Hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, for the salvation of His presence.

7.verse: My God, my soul is downcast within me! Therefore I remember You from the land of Jordan and from the peaks of Hermon, from Mount Mitzar.

8.verse: Deep calls to deep in the roar of Your waterfalls. All Your waves and breakers have swept over me.

9.verse: By day ADONAI commands His love, and at night His song is with me— a prayer to the God of my life.

10.verse: I will say to God my Rock: “Why have You forgotten me? Why do I go about mourning, under the oppression of the enemy?”

11.verse: As with a crushing in my bones, my adversaries taunt me, by saying to me all day, “Where is your God?”

1.verse: Send Forth Your Light Psalm 43 - Vindicate me, O God, and champion my cause against an ungodly nation. From a deceitful and unjust man, deliver me!

2.verse: For You are my God, my stronghold. Why have You spurned me? Why do I go about gloomy because of the oppression of the enemy?

3.verse: Send forth Your light and Your truth— let them guide me. Let them bring me to Your holy mountain and to Your dwelling places.

4.verse: Then I will come to the altar of God, to the God of my exceeding joy, and praise You upon the harp —O God, my God.

5.verse: Why are You downcast, O my soul? Why are you murmuring within me? Hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, the salvation of my countenance.

1.verse: Arise, O God of Our Fathers Psalm 44 - For the music director, a psalm of the sons of Korah, a contemplative song.

2.verse: We have heard with our ears, O God —our fathers have told us— of a work You did in their days, in days of old.

3.verse: With Your hand You displaced nations, but You planted them. You afflicted peoples, and You drove them out.

4.verse: For it was not by their own sword that they took possession of the land, nor did their own arm save them. But it was Your right hand, Your arm, and the light of Your face— for You favored them.

5.verse: You are my King, O God— command victories for Jacob!

6.verse: Through You we push back our foes. Through Your Name we trample those rising up against us.

7.verse: For I do not trust in my bow, nor can my sword save me.

8.verse: For You saved us from our oppressors and put to shame those who hated us.

9.verse: In God we make our boast all day and Your Name we praise forever. Selah

10.verse: Yet You have spurned and humiliated us, and no longer go out with our armies.

11.verse: You make us retreat before the enemy. Those who hate us have plundered us.

12.verse: You gave us to be devoured like sheep and have scattered us among the nations.

13.verse: You are selling Your people cheaply— not even getting a great price for them.

14.verse: You made us a taunt for our neighbors, a scorn and ridicule for those around us.

15.verse: You have made us a byword among the nations, head-wagging among the peoples.

16.verse: All day my disgrace is before me, and my face is covered with shame—

17.verse: because of the sound of taunting and reviling from the face of a vengeful enemy.

18.verse: All this came upon us, though we did not forget You, nor were we false to Your covenant.

19.verse: Our heart did not turn back, nor did our steps stray from Your path.

20.verse: Yet You crushed us in a place of jackals, covered us with the shadow of death.

21.verse: If we had forgotten the Name of our God or stretched our hands to a foreign god,

22.verse: would God not have discovered it? For He knows the secrets of the heart.

23.verse: But for Your sake we are slain all day. We are counted as sheep for slaughter.

24.verse: Awake! Why do you sleep, my Lord? Wake up! Do not cast us off forever.

25.verse: Why do You hide Your face and forget our misery and oppression?

26.verse: For our soul sinks down to the dust. Our belly cleaves to the earth.

1.verse: A Royal Wedding Song Psalm 45 - For the music director, according to “Lilies.” Of the sons of Korah, a contemplative song, a love song.

2.verse: My heart is stirred with a good word. I speak my verses to the king. My tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.

3.verse: You are the most handsome of the sons of men. Grace pours from your lips. Therefore God has blessed you forever.

4.verse: Gird your sword on your thigh, O mighty one, in your splendor and your majesty.

5.verse: In your majesty ride victoriously, on behalf of truth, meekness and justice. Let your right hand display awesome things.

6.verse: Your arrows are sharp. Peoples fall beneath you— into the heart of the king’s enemies.

7.verse: Your throne, O God, is forever and ever, and a scepter of justice is the scepter of Your kingdom.

8.verse: You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness. Therefore, God, your God, anointed you with the oil of gladness above your companions.

9.verse: All your robes have myrrh, aloes, cassia. From ivory palaces, stringed instruments make you glad.

10.verse: Kings’ daughters are among your honored women. At your right hand stands the queen in gold of Ophir.

11.verse: “Listen, O daughter, consider and incline your ear. Forget your people and your father’s house.

12.verse: Then the king will desire your beauty. Honor him, for he is your lord.

13.verse: A daughter of Tyre comes with a gift. The richest people will court your favor.”

14.verse: All glorious is the king’s daughter within the palace— her gown is interwoven with gold.

15.verse: She will be led to the king in embroidered garments. Her virgins, her companions following her, are coming in to you.

16.verse: They are led in with joy and gladness— they enter into the palace of the king.

17.verse: Your sons will take your fathers’ place. You will make them princes throughout the land.

1.verse: He Makes Wars Cease Psalm 46 - For the music director, of the sons of Korah, according to Alamoth, a song.

2.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

3.verse: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth change, though the mountains topple into the heart of the seas,

4.verse: though its waters roar and foam, though the mountains quake at their swelling. Selah

5.verse: There is a river whose streams make glad the city of God— the holy dwelling place of Elyon.

6.verse: God is in the midst of her, she will not be shaken. God will help her when morning dawns.

7.verse: Nations are in uproar, kingdoms totter, He utters His voice, the earth melts!

8.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot is with us. The God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah

9.verse: Come, see the works of ADONAI, who brings devastations on the earth.

10.verse: He makes wars cease to the end of the earth. He breaks the bow and shatters the spear. He burns chariots with fire.

11.verse: “Be still, and know that I am God. I am exalted among the nations. I am exalted in the earth.”

1.verse: In Celebration of God’s Reign Psalm 47 - For the music director, a psalm for the sons of Korah.

2.verse: Clap your hands, all you peoples! Shout to God with the voice of joy!

3.verse: For ADONAI Elyon is awesome, a great King over all the earth.

4.verse: He subdues peoples under us, and nations under our feet.

5.verse: He chooses our inheritance for us, the glory of Jacob whom He loved. Selah

6.verse: God is gone up amidst shouting, ADONAI amidst the sound of the shofar.

7.verse: Sing praises to God, sing praises! Sing praises to our King, sing praises!

8.verse: For God is the King of all the earth. Sing praises with a skillful song.

9.verse: God reigns over the nations. God sits upon His holy throne.

1.verse: Consider Zion’s Towers Psalm 48 - A song, a psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: Great is ADONAI, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God—His holy mountain.

3.verse: A beautiful height—the joy of the whole earth— is Mount Zion, on the northern side of the city of the great King.

4.verse: God, in her palaces, is known as a stronghold.

5.verse: For behold, the kings assembled, they advanced together.

6.verse: They saw, then they were astounded, they fled in terror.

7.verse: Trembling seized them there, pain like a woman in labor.

8.verse: With an east wind You broke the ships of Tarshish.

9.verse: As we have heard, so have we seen, in the city of ADONAI-Tzva’ot, in the city of our God. God will establish her forever. Selah

10.verse: We have meditated on Your lovingkindness, O God, in the midst of Your Temple.

11.verse: Like Your Name, O God, so is Your praise to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is full of righteousness.

12.verse: Mount Zion is glad, the daughters of Judah rejoice, because of Your judgments.

13.verse: Walk about Zion, go around her. Count her towers.

14.verse: Consider her ramparts, go through her palaces, so you may describe it to the next generation.

1.verse: Rich and Poor Alike Psalm 49 - For the music director: a psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: Hear this, all you peoples. Give ear, all you inhabitants of the world,

3.verse: both low and high, rich and poor together.

4.verse: My mouth speaks wisdom, My heart’s meditation is understanding.

5.verse: I will turn my ear to a proverb. I will utter my riddle on the harp:

6.verse: Why should I fear in evil days? when the iniquity of my deceivers surrounds me?

7.verse: Or those trusting in their wealth, boasting about their great riches?

8.verse: No man can redeem his brother, or give to God a ransom for him.

9.verse: For the redemption of a soul is costly— so, one should stop trying forever.

10.verse: Will he live forever— and never see the Pit?

11.verse: Surely he must see, even wise men die. The fool and the brutish will alike perish, leaving their wealth to others.

12.verse: Their inward thought is: Their houses are eternal, their dwellings for generation after generation. They name their lands after themselves.

13.verse: But the pompous man will not endure— he is like the beasts that perish.

14.verse: Such is the way of the self-confident, and their followers who approve their sayings. Selah

15.verse: Like sheep they are destined for Sheol. Death will be their shepherd and the upright will rule over them in the morning. Their image will decay in Sheol— far from its lofty place.

16.verse: But God redeems my soul from the power of Sheol— for He receives me. Selah

17.verse: Do not be afraid when a man gets rich, when his house’s splendor increases.

18.verse: For when he dies he takes nothing away. His splendor will not follow him down.

19.verse: Though during his life he congratulates himself, and men praise you when you do well for yourself—

20.verse: He will still join his fathers’ company, who will never see the light.

1.verse: A Sacrifice of Thanks Psalm 50 - A psalm of Asaph. God, Elohim ADONAI has spoken and summoned the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting.

2.verse: Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God shines forth.

3.verse: Our God comes, and does not keep silent. A fire is devouring before Him, and it storms around Him mightily.

4.verse: He calls to the heavens above and to the earth, to judge His people:

5.verse: “Gather My kedoshim to Me, who cut a covenant with Me with a sacrifice.”

6.verse: The heavens declare His righteousness, for God Himself is Judge. Selah

7.verse: “Hear, My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you: I am God, your God.

8.verse: I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices, for your burnt offerings are continually before Me.

9.verse: I have no need of a bull from your house nor goats from your pens.

10.verse: For every beast of the forest is Mine, and the cattle on a thousand hills.

11.verse: I know every bird of the mountains. Everything moving in the field is Mine.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell you— for the world is Mine and all it contains!

13.verse: Do I eat the flesh of bulls or drink the blood of goats?

14.verse: Offer God a sacrifice of thank offerings, then fulfill your vows to Elyon.

15.verse: Call upon Me in the day of trouble. When I rescue you, you will honor Me.”

16.verse: But to the wicked, God says: “What are you doing, reciting My laws and taking My covenant in your mouth?

17.verse: For you hate discipline, and you cast My words behind you.

18.verse: When you see a thief, you are pleased with him, and your portion is with adulterers.

19.verse: You have unleashed your mouth for evil and harnessed your tongue for deceit.

20.verse: You sit, speaking against your brother, slandering your own mother’s son.

21.verse: These things you have done—Should I keep silent? You thought I was just like you—but I reprove you, and set the case before your eyes.

22.verse: Now consider this, you who forget God. Or else I will tear you in pieces with no one to rescue you.

23.verse: A sacrifice of praise honors Me, and to the one who orders his way, I will show the salvation of God.”

1.verse: Create in Me a Clean Heart Psalm 51 - For the music director: a psalm of David,

2.verse: when Nathan the prophet came to him, after he went to Bathsheba.

3.verse: Be gracious to me, O God, according to Your mercy. According to Your great compassion blot out my transgressions.

4.verse: Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin.

5.verse: For I know my transgressions and my sin is ever before me.

6.verse: Against You, You only, have I sinned, and done what is evil in Your sight, so that You are just when You speak, and blameless when You judge.

7.verse: Behold, I was born in iniquity and in sin when my mother conceived me.

8.verse: Surely You desire truth in the inner being. Make me know wisdom inwardly.

9.verse: Cleanse me with hyssop and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

10.verse: Let me hear joy and gladness, so the bones You crushed may rejoice.

11.verse: Hide Your face from my sins, and blot out all my iniquities.

12.verse: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

13.verse: Do not cast me from Your presence— take not Your Ruach ha-Kodesh from me.

14.verse: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation and sustain me with a willing spirit.

15.verse: Then will I teach transgressors Your ways and sinners will return to You.

16.verse: Deliver me from bloodguilt, O God— God of my salvation. Then my tongue will sing for joy of Your righteousness.

17.verse: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare Your praise.

18.verse: For You would not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it, nor be pleased by burnt offerings.

19.verse: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit. A broken and a contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.

1.verse: Treacherous Tongue! Psalm 52 - For the music director: a contemplative song of David,

2.verse: when Doeg the Edomite came and reported to Saul telling him, “David went to Ahimelech’s house.”

3.verse: Why do you brag about evil, mighty man? God’s lovingkindness is every day.

4.verse: Your tongue plots destruction, like a sharp razor, working deceit.

5.verse: You love evil instead of good, lying rather than speaking right. Selah

6.verse: You love only devouring words— treacherous tongue!

7.verse: God will pull you down forever, and snatch you, rip you out of your tent, and uproot you from the land of the living. Selah

8.verse: Then the righteous will see and fear, and laugh at him:

9.verse: “Here is the man who did not make God his stronghold. Instead he trusted in his great riches— and was strong in his evil desire.”

1.verse: A Fool Denies God Psalm 53 - For the music director: on Mahalath, a contemplative song of David.

2.verse: The fool says in his heart: “There is no God.” They are corrupt, commit vile injustice. There is no one who does good.

3.verse: God looks down from the heavens on the children of men, to see if anyone understands, who seeks after God.

4.verse: All have turned aside— together they have become corrupt. There is no one who does good— no, not even one!

5.verse: Will the evildoers never learn? They consume My people as they would eat bread, and never call upon God.

6.verse: There they are in great dread— where there is nothing to fear. For God has scattered the bones of those besieging you. You have put them to shame, for God has rejected them.

1.verse: Surely God is My Helper Psalm 54 - For the music director, on stringed instruments, a contemplative song of David,

2.verse: when the Ziphites came and said to Saul: “Is not David hiding himself among us?”

3.verse: O God, save me by Your Name, vindicate me by Your might.

4.verse: O God, hear my prayer, listen to the words of my mouth.

5.verse: For strangers have risen up against me. Violent men seek after my soul. They do not set God before them. Selah

6.verse: Surely God is my helper. My Lord is the supporter of my soul.

7.verse: Let evil return to my foes. Silence them with Your truth!

1.verse: Betrayal by a Friend Psalm 55 - For the music director, on stringed instruments, a contemplative song of David.

2.verse: Give ear, O God, to my prayer and do not ignore my plea for help.

3.verse: Listen to me and answer me. I am restless in my complaint and moan—

4.verse: because of the voice of the enemy, because of the pressure of the wicked. For they thrust trouble on me, and in anger bear a grudge against me.
