5.verse: My heart shudders within me and the terrors of death sweep over me.

6.verse: Fear and trembling come upon me and horror has overwhelmed me.

7.verse: So I said, “Oh that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and find rest.

8.verse: Surely I would flee far away. I would stay in the wilderness. Selah

9.verse: I would hurry to my shelter from the rushing wind of the storm.”

10.verse: Lord, confuse and confound their speech, for I see violence and strife in the city.

11.verse: Day and night they make the rounds on her walls. Iniquity and mischief are within her.

12.verse: Ruins are in her midst. Oppression and deceit never leave her square.

13.verse: For if it were an enemy taunting me, I could endure it. If my foe was exalting himself over me, I could hide from him.

14.verse: But it is you, a man like me— my companion and my close friend!

15.verse: Together we enjoyed great fellowship. We used to walk with the throng in the House of God.

16.verse: Let desolation come upon them, let them go down alive into Sheol— for evil is in their dwelling, among them.

17.verse: As for me, I will call on God, and ADONAI will save me.

18.verse: Evening, morning and noon, I complain and moan, then He hears my voice.

19.verse: He will redeem my soul in shalom from the battle against me. For many are striving with me.

20.verse: God will hear and humble them —yes, the One enthroned of old. Selah Nothing changes—they do not fear God.

21.verse: My companion put forth his hands against those at peace with him, as he violates his covenant.

22.verse: Smoother than butter was his speech, yet war was in his heart. His words were softer than oil, yet they were drawn swords.

23.verse: Cast your burden on ADONAI, and He will sustain you. He will never let the righteous be shaken.

1.verse: In God I Trust Psalm 56 - For the music director: “A Silent Dove Far Away,” a Michtam of David, when the Philistines had seized him in Gath.

2.verse: Be gracious to me, O God! For man has crushed me, fighting all day he oppresses me.

3.verse: My foes trample me all day. For many are fighting me arrogantly.

4.verse: In a day when I am afraid, I will put my trust in You.

5.verse: In God—I keep praising His word— in God I trust, I will not fear. What can mere flesh do to me?

6.verse: All day they twist my words. All their thoughts are against me for evil.

7.verse: They stir up strife; they lie hidden. They mark my steps, eager to take my soul.

8.verse: In spite of such sin, will they escape? In fierce anger, O God, cast down such people!

9.verse: You have recorded my wanderings. You put my tears in Your bottle. Are they not in Your book?

10.verse: Then my enemies will turn back in the day I call. This I know—that God is for me.

11.verse: In God—I keep praising His word— in ADONAI—I keep praising His word—

12.verse: in God I trust, I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

13.verse: I am under vows to You, O God. I will present thank offerings to You.

1.verse: Be Exalted Over All the Earth Psalm 57 - For the music director, “Do Not Destroy,” a Michtam of David, when he fled from Saul, in the cave.

2.verse: Be gracious to me, O God, be gracious to me, for in You my soul takes refuge. In the shadow of Your wings I take refuge, until destruction passes by.

3.verse: I will cry out to El Elyon, to God who accomplishes it for me.

4.verse: He will send from heaven and save me. He rebukes the one trampling on me. Selah God is sending His mercy and His truth.

5.verse: My soul is in the midst of lions. I lie among those breathing fire— sons of men whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongue is a sharp sword.

6.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens. Let Your glory be over all the earth!

7.verse: They spread a net for my steps, my soul is bowed down. They have dug a pit before me— they fell into it themselves. Selah

8.verse: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast. I will sing, yes, I will make music.

9.verse: Awake, my glory! Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.

10.verse: I will praise You, my Lord, among the peoples. I will sing praises to You among the nations.

11.verse: For Your lovingkindness is great up to the heavens, and Your truth to the skies.

1.verse: God Really Judges Psalm 58 - For the music director: “Do Not Destroy,” a Michtam of David.

2.verse: Do you really speak of justice, O “gods”? Do you judge with fairness, sons of man?

3.verse: No, in heart you devise injustice. Your hands weigh out violence on earth.

4.verse: The wicked are strangers from the womb. Speaking lies, they go astray from birth.

5.verse: Their venom is like a serpent’s venom, like a deaf cobra shutting its ear—

6.verse: not hearing the voice of charmers, or a cunning spell binder.

7.verse: O God, break their teeth in their mouths. Tear out the fangs of young lions, ADONAI.

8.verse: Let them flow away like water that runs off. When he bends his bow, let the arrows be cut off.

9.verse: Like a slug melting away as it slithers, like a woman’s miscarriage, may they never see the sun.

10.verse: Even before your pots can feel a thorn —whether alive or ablaze— He will sweep the wicked away.

11.verse: The righteous one will rejoice when he beholds vengeance, when he washes his feet in the blood of the wicked.

1.verse: God Is My Strong Tower Psalm 59 - For the music director: “Do Not Destroy,” a Michtam of David, when Saul sent men to watch the house to kill him.

2.verse: Deliver me from my enemies, my God! Set me on high, away from those who rise up against me.

3.verse: Deliver me from workers of iniquity. Rescue me from bloodthirsty men.

4.verse: For behold, they lie in wait for me. Defiant men stir up strife against me— not for my transgression or sin, ADONAI.

5.verse: For no guilt of mine, they run and set things up. Awake! Help me! Look!

6.verse: For You are ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot, the God of Israel! Rouse Yourself to punish all the nations. Show no mercy to any iniquitous traitors. Selah

7.verse: They return at evening, snarling like a dog, prowling about the city.

8.verse: See, they are spewing with their mouth —swords in their lips— “After all, who is listening?”

9.verse: But You, ADONAI, are laughing at them. You scoff at all the nations.

10.verse: O my strength, I watch for You— for God is my strong tower.

11.verse: My God in His lovingkindness will go before me. God will let me look down on my foes.

12.verse: Do not slay them, lest my people forget. With Your power shake them and bring them down, O Lord our shield.

13.verse: The sin of their mouth is the words of their lips. So let them be caught in their pride, and for uttering a curse and a lie.

14.verse: Consume them in wrath, consume them till they are no more. Let them know that God rules over Jacob to the ends of the earth. Selah

15.verse: They return at evening, snarling like a dog, prowling about the city.

16.verse: They wander around for food. If they are not full, they stay up all night.

17.verse: But I—I sing of Your strength! Yes, in the morning I sing aloud of Your lovingkindness. For You have been my fortress, a refuge in the day of my trouble.

1.verse: Song of Victory Over Edom Psalm 60 - For the music director, on the “Lily of the Covenant,” a Michtam of David, for teaching,

2.verse: when he fought with Aram-Naharaim and with Aram-Zobah, and Joab returned and struck down twelve thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

3.verse: O God, You have spurned us. You have broken out against us. You have been angry. Turn back to us!

4.verse: You made earth shake; You split it open. Heal its fractures—for it shudders.

5.verse: You made Your people see hardship. You made us drink wine of staggering.

6.verse: To those who fear You, You gave a banner, to be unfurled before the archers. Selah

7.verse: Save with Your right hand and answer us, so that Your beloved may be delivered.

8.verse: God has spoken in His holiness: “I will exult! I will parcel out Shechem and measure off the valley of Succoth.

9.verse: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine, Ephraim is a helmet for my head, Judah is my scepter.

10.verse: Moab is my washbasin, On Edom I toss my sandal, Philistia, cry aloud because of me!”

11.verse: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

12.verse: Should it not be You, O God— who spurned us and no longer goes out with our armies?

1.verse: Lead Me to the Rock Psalm 61 - For the music director, on string instrument, of David.

2.verse: Hear my cry, O God, listen to my prayer.

3.verse: From the end of the earth I call to You when my heart is faint. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.

4.verse: For You have been a refuge for me, a tower of strength before the enemy.

5.verse: Let me dwell in Your tent forever. Let me take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah

6.verse: For You have heard my vows, O God. You have given the inheritance of those who fear Your Name.

7.verse: May You add days to the king’s days. May his years span many generations.

8.verse: May he be enthroned before God forever. Appoint mercy and truth to protect him.

1.verse: My Rock and My Salvation Psalm 62 - For the music director, on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

2.verse: My soul, wait in stillness, only for God— from Him comes my salvation.

3.verse: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress—I will never be moved.

4.verse: How long will all of you assault a man, to crush him, like a leaning wall, a fence to be torn down?

5.verse: They only plot to topple him from his rank. Delighting in falsehood, they bless with their mouth, but inwardly they curse. Selah

6.verse: My soul, wait in stillness, only for God— for from Him comes my expectation.

7.verse: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my strong tower—I will not be moved.

8.verse: On God, my salvation and my glory is the rock of my strength. My refuge is in God.

9.verse: Trust in Him at all times, you people. Pour out your heart in His presence. God is our refuge. Selah

10.verse: Sons of Adam are a vapor, sons of man are an illusion. In balanced scales they go up— altogether they are less than a breath.

11.verse: Do not trust in extortion, and do not put vain hope in plunder. Though these things increase riches, do not set your heart on them.

12.verse: Once God has spoken, twice I have heard this: might belongs to God.

1.verse: You Are My God Psalm 63 - A psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah.

2.verse: O God, You are my God, earnestly I seek You. My soul thirsts for You. My flesh longs for You in a dry and weary land, where there is no water.

3.verse: So, I looked for You in the Sanctuary, to see Your power and Your glory.

4.verse: Since Your lovingkindness is better than life, my lips will praise You.

5.verse: So I will bless You as long as I live. In Your name I lift up my hands.

6.verse: My soul is satisfied as with fat and oil, so my mouth praises You with joyful lips.

7.verse: When I remember You on my bed, I meditate on You through the night watches.

8.verse: For You have been my help, and in the shadow of Your wings I sing for joy.

9.verse: My soul clings to You— Your right hand upholds me.

10.verse: But those who seek my soul to destroy it will go down to the depths of the earth.

11.verse: They will be gutted by the sword, and become a prey for jackals.

1.verse: Protect Me from Conspiracies Psalm 64 - For the music director, a psalm of David.

2.verse: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint. Protect my life from terror of the enemy.

3.verse: Hide me from the conspiracy of evildoers, from the tumult of workers of iniquity,

4.verse: who sharpened their tongue like a sword, and aimed their arrow—bitter words,

5.verse: to shoot from hiding at the innocent, shooting suddenly at him, with no fear.

6.verse: They are firming up their evil plan. They talk about setting secret traps. They asked, “Who would see them?”

7.verse: They are plotting injustices: “We have completed a perfect plot!” A man’s inward part and heart are deep.

8.verse: But God will shoot them with an arrow— suddenly their wounds will appear.

9.verse: So their tongue will be their downfall. All who see them will flee away.

10.verse: Then all men will fear. So they will declare the work of God, and ponder what He has done.

1.verse: Praise is Awaitng You in Zion Psalm 65 - For the music director, a psalm, a song of David.

2.verse: Praise is awaiting You in Zion, O God, and to You the vow will be fulfilled.

3.verse: O You who hear prayer, to You all flesh will come.

4.verse: Records of sins overwhelm me— You will atone for our transgressions.

5.verse: Blessed is the one You choose and bring near to dwell in Your courts! We will be satisfied with the goodness of Your House—Your holy Temple.

6.verse: You respond to us in righteousness with awe-inspiring works —O God of our salvation— hope of all ends of the earth and farthest seas,

7.verse: who establishes mountains by His power, being girded with might,

8.verse: who stills the roaring of the seas, the roaring of their waves, and the tumult of the peoples.

9.verse: Those dwelling in the uttermost parts stand in awe of Your signs. You make morning and evening shout for joy.

10.verse: You visit the land and make it abundant, greatly enriching it— the stream of God is full of water. You prepare their grain, for so You have prepared the earth.

11.verse: You drench her furrows, leveling the ridges. You soften her with showers, blessing her growth.

12.verse: You crown the year with Your goodness. Your wagon tracks drip with abundance.

13.verse: Pastures of the wilderness overflow and hills are robed with joy.

1.verse: How Awesome Your Deeds Psalm 66 - For the music director, a song, a psalm. Shout joyfully to God, all the earth!

2.verse: Sing the glory of His Name— make His praise glorious.

3.verse: Say to God: “How awesome are Your deeds! Because of Your great power, Your enemies cringe before You.

4.verse: All the earth bows down to You, and sings praises to You. All sing praises to Your Name.” Selah

5.verse: Come and see the works of God. How awesome His deeds for the children of Adam!

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land. They crossed the river on foot. There let us rejoice in Him!

7.verse: He rules by His might forever. His eyes keep watch on the nations. Let no rebels exalt themselves. Selah

8.verse: Bless our God, O peoples! Let the sound of His praise be heard.

9.verse: Keeping our soul in life, He has not let our foot slip.

10.verse: For You have tested us, O God— You have purified us, as silver is refined.

11.verse: You brought us into a net. You laid a burden on our backs.

12.verse: You caused men to ride over our heads. We went through fire and water. Yet You brought us out to superabundance.

13.verse: With burnt offerings I will come to Your House, fulfilling my vows to You

14.verse: that my lips uttered and mouth spoke, when I was in trouble.

15.verse: To You I will present burnt offerings of fat animals, with the sweet smoke of rams. I will offer bulls with goats. Selah

16.verse: Come and listen, all you who fear God. I will tell what He has done for my soul.

17.verse: I cried out to Him with my mouth, and exaltation was on my tongue.

18.verse: If I had cherished iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.

19.verse: But surely God has heard. He has listened to my voice in prayer.

20.verse: Blessed be God, who has not turned away my prayer, nor His lovingkindness from me.

1.verse: Let All Peoples Praise You Psalm 67 - For the music director, with stringed instruments, a psalm, a song.

2.verse: May God be gracious to us and bless us. May He cause His face to shine upon us—Selah

3.verse: so that Your way may be known on earth, and Your salvation among all nations.

4.verse: Let the peoples praise You, O God. Let all the peoples praise You.

5.verse: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for You will judge the peoples fairly, and guide the nations on the earth. Selah

6.verse: Let the peoples praise You, O God. Let all the peoples praise You.

7.verse: The earth has yielded its harvest— God, our God will bless us.

1.verse: Triumphal Procession up to the Temple Psalm 68 - For the music director, a psalm of David, a song.

2.verse: Let God arise! Let His enemies be scattered! Let those who hate Him flee before Him.

3.verse: As smoke is blown away, may You blow them away. As wax melts before the fire, may the wicked perish before God.

4.verse: But let the righteous be glad. Let them exult before God. Let them rejoice with gladness.

5.verse: Sing to God, sing praises to His Name. Prepare the road for Him who rides through the deserts, whose Name is ADONAI— and rejoice before Him.

6.verse: A father of orphans, defender of widows, is God in His holy dwelling.

7.verse: God settles the lonely in a home. He leads prisoners out to prosperity. But the rebellious live in a parched land.

8.verse: O God, when You went out before Your people, when You marched through the desert—Selah—

9.verse: the earth shook, the heavens rained at the presence of God—the One of Sinai— at the presence of God, God of Israel.

10.verse: You poured down abundant rain, O God. You sustained Your weary inheritance.

11.verse: Your community settled in it. In Your goodness, O God, You provided for the poor.

12.verse: The Lord gives the word— a great company of women proclaims the good news.

13.verse: “Kings of armies, flee, flee!” She who stays at home divides the spoil.

14.verse: When you lie among the campfires, wings of a dove were covered with silver and her feathers with shimmering gold.

15.verse: When Shaddai scattered kings there, it was snowing on Zalmon.

16.verse: Mount Bashan is a mountain of God. Mount Bashan is a mountain of peaks.

17.verse: Why do you gaze with envy, you mountain peaks, at the mountain God desired for His dwelling? Yes, ADONAI will dwell there forever!

18.verse: The chariots of God are thousands and thousands —my Lord is among them as at Sinai, in holiness.

19.verse: You went up on high. You led captivity captive. You received gifts from humanity, even from the rebellious— so that God might dwell there.

20.verse: Blessed be my Lord! Day by day He bears our burdens— the God of our salvation! Selah

21.verse: God is for us—a God of deliverance. ADONAI my Lord has escapes from death.

22.verse: Surely God crushes the head of His foes, the hairy scalp of one walking in his guilt.

23.verse: My Lord said: “I will bring them back from Bashan, I will bring them back from the depths of the sea.

24.verse: So your foot may wade in blood, and your dogs’ tongue may have their share of your enemies’ blood.”

25.verse: They have seen Your processions, O God— the processions of my God, my King, into the Sanctuary:

26.verse: The singers go before, the musicians last, between maidens beating tambourines.

27.verse: “Bless God in the congregations— ADONAI, from the fountain of Israel.”

28.verse: There Benjamin, the youngest, is leading them, there the throng of Judah’s princes, there the princes of Zebulun, there the princes of Naphtali.

29.verse: Your God commanded your strength. Strengthen, O God, You who have acted for us.

30.verse: From Your Temple above Jerusalem, kings bring You tribute.

31.verse: Rebuke the beast of the reeds, the herd of bulls with the calves, peoples trampling down pieces of silver. He has scattered the peoples who delight in war!

32.verse: Nobles come from Egypt. Cush runs to stretch her hands to God.

33.verse: Sing to God, kingdoms of the earth, sing praises to the Lord—Selah—

34.verse: to Him who rides upon the ancient heavens of heavens. Look, He utters His voice, a mighty voice!

35.verse: Ascribe strength to God— His majesty is over Israel and His strength is in the skies.

1.verse: Scorn and Disgrace, Gall and Vinegar Psalm 69 - For the music director, on “Lilies,” of David.

2.verse: Save me, O God, for the waters have reached my soul.

3.verse: I have sunk in deep mud, and there is no footing, I have come into deep waters, and a flood sweeps over me.

4.verse: I am worn out by my crying, my throat is parched, my eyes fail, waiting for my God.

5.verse: Those who hate me without a cause outnumber the hairs of my head. Powerful are my enemies who would destroy me with lies. What I did not steal, must I restore?

6.verse: O God, You know my folly, nor are my trespasses hidden from You.

7.verse: May those who hope in You not be ashamed because of me, my Lord, ADONAI-Tzva’ot. May those who seek You not be disgraced because of me, O God of Israel.

8.verse: For I have endured scorn for Your sake. Disgrace has covered my face.

9.verse: I have become a stranger to my brothers, a foreigner to my mother’s children.

10.verse: For zeal for Your House consumed me— the insults of those who insulted You have fallen on me.

11.verse: When I wept and fasted— that became a reproach to me.

12.verse: When I put on sackcloth, I became a joke to them.

13.verse: Those who sit at the gate chatter about me, and I am the song of the drunkards.

14.verse: But as for me, my prayer to You, ADONAI, is for a time of favor. O God, in Your great love, answer me with the truth of Your salvation.

15.verse: Deliver me from the mire— do not let me sink. Deliver me from those who hate me, out of the deep waters.

16.verse: Do not let floodwaters sweep over me, nor the deep swallow me up, nor the Pit shut its mouth over me.

17.verse: Answer me, ADONAI, for good is Your mercy. With Your great compassion, turn to me.

18.verse: Hide not Your face from Your servant. For I am in distress—answer me quickly.

19.verse: Draw near to my soul and redeem it. Ransom me because of my foes.

20.verse: You know my reproach, my shame, my disgrace. All my adversaries are before You.

21.verse: Scorn has broken my heart, so I am sick. I looked for sympathy, but there was none, for comforters, but found none.

22.verse: They put gall in my food, and for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.

23.verse: Let their table before them be a snare, and what should have been for their well-being, let it be a trap.

24.verse: Let their eyes be darkened so they cannot see and their backs be bent forever.

25.verse: Pour out Your indignation on them. Let Your fierce anger overtake them.

26.verse: Let their encampment be deserted. Let none dwell in their tents.

27.verse: For they persecute the one You have smitten, so they tell of the pain of those You have wounded.

28.verse: Add guilt to their guilt— may they not come into Your righteousness.

29.verse: May they be wiped out of the book of life and not be recorded with the righteous.

30.verse: But I—I am afflicted and in pain. Let Your salvation, O God, set me up on high.

31.verse: I will praise God’s Name with a song, and magnify Him with praise.

32.verse: It will please ADONAI better than an ox or a bull with horns and hoofs.

33.verse: The humble will see it and be glad. You who seek God, let your hearts revive.

34.verse: For ADONAI hears the needy and does not despise His captive people.

35.verse: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and everything moving in them.

36.verse: For God will save Zion, and rebuild the cities of Judah. Then they will dwell there and possess it.

1.verse: My Help and My Deliverer Psalm 70 - For the music director, of David, for a memorial.

2.verse: O God, come quickly to deliver me, ADONAI, to help me.

3.verse: May they be put to shame and disgrace who seek my life. May they be turned back in humiliation who delight in my hurt.

4.verse: May those who say, “Aha! Aha!” be turned away because of their shame.

5.verse: But may all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You. May those who love Your salvation always say, “Let God be magnified.”

1.verse: My Hope When I Am Gray Psalm 71 - In You, ADONAI, have I taken refuge. Let me never be ashamed.

2.verse: Deliver me and rescue me in Your justice. Turn Your ear to me and save me.

3.verse: Be to me a sheltering rock where I may always go. Give the command to save me— for You are my rock and my fortress.

4.verse: My God, rescue me out of the hand of the wicked, out of the grasp of an evil, ruthless man.

5.verse: For You are my hope, ADONAI my Lord— my trust from my youth.

6.verse: From my birth I have leaned on You. You took me out of my mother’s womb. My praise is always about You.

7.verse: I am like an ominous sign to many, but You are my strong refuge.

8.verse: My mouth is filled with Your praise and with Your glory all day.

9.verse: Do not cast me away in the time of old age. When my strength fails, do not forsake me.

10.verse: For my enemies speak against me. Those who watch for my soul conspire together,

11.verse: saying: “God has forsaken him— Pursue and take him, for no one will deliver.”

12.verse: O God, be not far from me! My God, come quickly to help me.

13.verse: Let the accusers of my soul be disgraced and destroyed. Let those who seek to harm me be covered with scorn and confusion.

14.verse: But I—I will hope continually and will praise You more and more.

15.verse: My mouth will recount Your justice and Your salvation all day, though I do not know the sum of them.

16.verse: I come because of the mighty deeds of ADONAI my Lord. I will remember Your righteousness—Yours alone.

17.verse: God, You taught me from my youth, and I still keep declaring Your wonders.

18.verse: So even until I am old and gray, O God, do not forsake me, till I tell of Your strong arm to the next generation, Your might to all who are to come.

19.verse: For Your righteousness, O God, reaches to high heaven. You have done great things—O God, who is like You?

20.verse: You made me see many troubles and evils —You will revive me again— from the depths of the earth You will bring me up again.

21.verse: You will increase my greatness, and comfort me once again.

22.verse: So I will praise You with the harp for your truth, O my God. I will sing praises to You with the lyre O Holy One of Israel.

23.verse: My lips will shout for joy —when I sing praises to You— and my soul, which You have redeemed.

24.verse: Also my tongue will tell of Your righteousness all day. For those who seek my hurt have been put to shame and confusion.

1.verse: A Powerful King for the Poor Psalm 72 - Of Solomon. Give the king Your judgments, O God, and Your righteousness to the king’s son.

2.verse: May he judge Your people with righteousness, and Your poor ones with justice.

3.verse: Let the mountains bring shalom to the people, and the hills righteousness.

4.verse: May he vindicate the poor of the people, save the children of the needy, and crush the oppressor.

5.verse: Let them fear You while the sun endures, and while the moon lasts, throughout all generations.

6.verse: May he be like rain falling on a mown field, like showers watering the ground.

7.verse: Let the righteous flourish in his days. Let shalom abound till the moon is no more.

8.verse: May he have dominion from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: Let desert dwellers bow before him, and his enemies lick the dust.

10.verse: May kings of Tarshish and the islands bring tribute, kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.

11.verse: So let all kings bow down before him, and all nations serve him.

12.verse: For he rescues the needy crying for help, also the poor and the one with no helper.

13.verse: He will take pity on the poor and needy, and the souls of the needy he will save.

14.verse: From oppression and violence he redeems their soul, for precious is their blood in his sight.

15.verse: Long may he live! May gold from Sheba be given to him. May he pray for him continually, and bless him all day.

16.verse: Let there be abundance of grain in the land. Let it sway on the top of the hills, let its fruit be like Lebanon, and let people of the city flourish like grass of the field.

17.verse: May his name endure forever. May his name increase before the sun, and may all nations be blessed by him and call him blessed.

18.verse: Blessed be ADONAI Elohim, God of Israel, who alone does wonders.

19.verse: Blessed be His glorious Name forever. May all the earth be filled with His glory! Amen and Amen!

20.verse: The prayers of David son of Jesse are complete.

1.verse: God Is the Strength of My Heart Psalm 73 - A psalm of Asaph. Surely God is good to Israel, to the pure in heart.

2.verse: But as for me, my feet almost slipped. My steps nearly slid out from under me.

3.verse: For I envied the arrogant, when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

4.verse: For there are no pains at their death, their body is healthy.

5.verse: They have none of humanity’s trouble, nor are they plagued like others.

6.verse: Therefore, they put on pride as a necklace, and violence wraps around them like a garment.

7.verse: Their eyes bulge out from fatness. The imaginations of their hearts run wild.

8.verse: They scoff and wickedly plan evil. From on high they threaten.

9.verse: They set their mouth against heaven. Their tongue struts through the earth.

10.verse: Therefore His people return here, while they drink their fill.

11.verse: So they say: “How does God know? And does Elyon have knowledge?”

12.verse: Behold, such are the wicked— always at ease and amassing wealth.

13.verse: Surely in vain have I kept my heart pure, and washed my hands in innocence.

14.verse: For all day I have been stricken, my chastisement comes every morning.

15.verse: If I had said: “I will speak thus,” surely I would have betrayed a generation of Your children.

16.verse: But when I tried to make sense of this, it was troubling in my eyes—

17.verse: until I entered the Sanctuary of God, and perceived their end.

18.verse: Surely You put them in slippery places. You hurled them down to destruction.

19.verse: How suddenly they became a ruin— terminated, consumed by terrors.

20.verse: Like a dream when one awakes, thus when You arise, my Lord, You will despise their form.

21.verse: When my heart was embittered and I was pierced in my heart,

22.verse: I was brutish and ignorant. I was like a beast before You.

23.verse: Yet I am continually with You. You hold my right hand.

24.verse: You guide me with Your counsel, and afterward You will take me into glory.

25.verse: Whom have I in heaven but You? On earth there is none I desire besides You.

26.verse: My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.

27.verse: For behold, those far from You will perish. You put an end to all who like a harlot are unfaithful to You.

28.verse: But for me, it is good to be near God. I have made my Lord ADONAI my refuge. So I will tell of all Your works.

1.verse: Intercession for Restoration of Zion Psalm 74 - A contemplative song of Asaph. Why have You cast us off forever, O God? Why does Your anger smolder against the flock of Your pasture?

2.verse: Remember Your congregation, which You purchased of old, redeemed as the tribe of Your inheritance, and Mount Zion, where You dwelt.

3.verse: Lift Your steps toward the perpetual ruins— an enemy has done all evil to the Sanctuary!

4.verse: Your adversaries have roared in the midst of Your meeting place. They have set up their standards as signs.

5.verse: It seemed like bringing up axes into a thicket of trees—

6.verse: and now all its carved work they smash with hatchet and hammers!

7.verse: They set Your Sanctuary on fire, burning it to the ground. They defiled the dwelling place of Your Name.

8.verse: They said in their hearts: “Let us crush them totally!” They burned down all the meeting places of God in the land.

9.verse: We do not see our signs. No longer is there any prophet— and no one among us knows how long.

10.verse: How long, O God, will the adversary mock? Will the enemy revile Your Name forever?

11.verse: Why do You hold back Your hand, Your right hand? Draw it out of Your bosom and consume them!

12.verse: Yet God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the land.

13.verse: You split the sea with Your power. You smashed the monsters’ heads in the waters.

14.verse: You crushed the heads of Leviathan, giving him as food to the desert dwellers.

15.verse: You opened up spring and brook. You dried up ever-flowing rivers.

16.verse: The day is Yours, the night also is Yours. You provided moon and sun.

17.verse: You set all the borders of earth. You made summer and winter.

18.verse: Remember how the enemy mocked, ADONAI, and how foolish people despised Your Name.

19.verse: Do not deliver Your turtledove’s soul to the wild beast. Do not forget the life of Your afflicted ones forever.

20.verse: Look upon the covenant—for haunts of violence fill the dark places of earth.

21.verse: Do not let the oppressed turn back in shame. But let the poor and needy praise Your Name.

22.verse: Rise up O God, and defend Your cause. Remember how the fool mocks You all day.

23.verse: Do not forget the noise of Your foes, the uproar of those rising up against You, ascending continually.

1.verse: He Lowers One and Lifts Another Psalm 75 - For the music director: “Do not Destroy,” a psalm of Asaph, a song.

2.verse: We praise You, we praise God, for Your Name is near. People declare Your wonders.

3.verse: “When I appoint a set time, I Myself will judge uprightly.

4.verse: When the earth wavers with living on it, I Myself hold its pillars firm. Selah

5.verse: I say to the arrogant, ‘No more boasting!’ And to the wicked, ‘Do not be lifting up your horn.’

6.verse: Do not lift your horn up high. Do not speak with outstretched neck.”

7.verse: For exaltation comes not from the east nor from the west, nor even from the desert.

8.verse: For God is the Judge: He lowers one and lifts up another.

9.verse: For in the hand of ADONAI is a cup of foaming wine mixed with spices, and He pours it out. Surely all the wicked of the earth will drink, draining it down to the dregs.

10.verse: But I—I will declare it forever, I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

1.verse: Who Can Stand in Your Presence? Psalm 76 - For the music director, on stringed instruments: a psalm of Asaph, a song.

2.verse: In Judah God is known. In Israel His Name is great.

3.verse: In Salem is His sukkah and His dwelling place in Zion.

4.verse: There He broke the fiery shafts of the bow, the shield, the sword, and the battle. Selah

5.verse: You are brilliant, more majestic than nourishing mountains.

6.verse: The valiant have been plundered— they slumbered in their sleep. The mighty could not lift their hands.

7.verse: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both horse and rider lay dead asleep.

8.verse: You are awesome, yes You are! Who can stand in Your presence once You are angry?

9.verse: From heaven You pronounced judgment. The earth feared and was still—

10.verse: when God rose up to judgment, to save all the humble of the land. Selah

11.verse: For wrath upon man will bring You praise, a remnant of wrath You put on as a belt.

12.verse: Make vows to ADONAI your God and fulfill them. Let all around Him bring tribute to the One who is to be feared.

1.verse: Remember the Wonders Psalm 77 - For the music director, on Jeduthun: a psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: My voice to God—and I cried out, my voice to God—and He heard me!

3.verse: In the day of my trouble I seek my Lord. At night my hand stretches out untiringly. My soul refuses to be comforted.

4.verse: I remember God and I moan. I muse, and my spirit grows faint. Selah

5.verse: You hold my eyelids open— I am so troubled—I cannot speak.

6.verse: I ponder the days of old, the years long ago.

7.verse: In the night I remember my song. I meditate with my heart and my spirit is searching.

8.verse: “Will the Lord reject forever and never again show favor?

9.verse: Has His mercy vanished forever? Has His promise come to an end forever?

10.verse: Has God forgotten to be gracious? Or has He in anger withdrawn his mercies?” Selah

11.verse: Then I said: “It wounds me— that the right hand of Elyon has changed.”

12.verse: I will remember the deeds of ADONAI. Yes, I will muse about Your wonders of old.

13.verse: I will meditate also on all Your work and consider Your deeds.”

14.verse: O God, Your way is holy. What god is great like God?

15.verse: You are the God who works wonders. You have made Your power known among the peoples.

16.verse: With your arm You redeemed Your people, the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

17.verse: The waters saw You, O God, the waters saw You and writhed, even the depths shook.

18.verse: The clouds poured out water, the skies resounded, Your arrows flashed back and forth.

19.verse: The sound of Your thunder was in the whirlwind. Lightning lit up the world. The earth trembled and shook.

20.verse: Your way was in the sea, and Your path in the mighty waters, but Your footprints were not seen.

1.verse: Israel from Moses to David Psalm 78 - A contemplative song of Asaph. Listen, my people, to my teaching. Turn your ears to the words of my mouth.

2.verse: I will open my mouth with a parable. I will utter perplexing sayings from of old,

3.verse: which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.

4.verse: We will not hide them from their children, telling to the next generation the praises of ADONAI and His strength and the wonders He has done.

5.verse: For He established a testimony in Jacob and ordained Torah in Israel, which He commanded our fathers to teach their children,

6.verse: so that the next generation might know, even the children yet to be born: they will arise and tell their children.

7.verse: Then they will put their trust in God, not forgetting the works of God, but keeping His mitzvot.

8.verse: So they will not be like their fathers— a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation that did not prepare its heart, whose spirit was not loyal to God.

9.verse: The sons of Ephraim were archers armed with bows, yet they turned back in the day of battle.

10.verse: They did not keep God’s covenant and refused to walk in His Torah.

11.verse: They forgot His deeds and His wonders that He had shown them.

12.verse: He did miracles in front of their fathers in the land of Egypt, in the plain of Zoan.

13.verse: He split the sea and led them through, and He made the water stand like a wall.

14.verse: By day He led them with a cloud and all night with a light of fire.

15.verse: He split apart rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as abundant as the depths.

16.verse: So He brought streams out of a rock, and made waters flow down like rivers.

17.verse: Yet they added more sinning against Him, rebelling against Elyon in the desert.

18.verse: They put God to the test in their heart by demanding food for their craving.

19.verse: Then they spoke against God, saying, “Can God set a table in the wilderness?

20.verse: See, He struck the rock, waters gushed out, streams overflowed. But can He give bread? Will He provide meat for His people?”

21.verse: When ADONAI heard, He was angry. A fire was kindled against Jacob, and fury also rose against Israel.

22.verse: For they did not believe in God or trust in His salvation.

23.verse: Yet He commanded the skies above and opened the doors of heaven,

24.verse: and rained down manna upon them to eat, and gave them grain of heaven.

25.verse: Man did eat the bread of angels. He sent them abundant provision.

26.verse: He loosed the east wind in the skies, and by His power He drove the south wind.

27.verse: He rained meat upon them like dust, and winged fowl like sand of the seas.

28.verse: And He let it fall amidst their camp, all around their tents.

29.verse: So they ate and were very full— for He gave them their desire.

30.verse: No longer a stranger from their desire, while their food was still in their mouths,

31.verse: the anger of God rose against them and slew the stoutest of them, and struck down young men of Israel.

32.verse: Despite all this they sinned still more, and did not trust in His wonders.

33.verse: So He ended their days in futility and their years in terror.

34.verse: But when He slew them, then they sought Him, and turned back, and desired God eagerly.

35.verse: Then they remembered that God was their Rock and El Elyon their Redeemer.

36.verse: But they flattered Him with their mouth and kept lying to Him with their tongue.

37.verse: For their heart was not steadfast with Him, nor were they faithful to His covenant.

38.verse: But He is compassionate, forgives iniquity and does not destroy. Yes, many times He restrains His anger, and does not stir up all His wrath.

39.verse: For He remembered that they are but flesh, a passing breath that never returns.

40.verse: How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness, and grieved Him in the desert!

41.verse: Again and again they tested God, and pained the Holy One of Israel.

42.verse: They did not remember His hand— the day He redeemed them from the foe,

43.verse: when He displayed His signs in Egypt and His wonders in the plain of Zoan.

44.verse: He turned their rivers into blood, so they could not drink from their streams.

45.verse: He sent on them flies to devour them, and frogs to devastate them,

46.verse: and gave their crops to the grasshopper, and their labor to the locust.

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore trees with frost,

48.verse: and gave over their cattle to the hail, and their flocks to fiery bolts.

49.verse: He sent on them the fury of His anger —wrath and indignation and trouble— a band of evil angels.

50.verse: He cleared a path for His anger. He spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the plague.

51.verse: He struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstfruits of their strength in the tents of Ham.

52.verse: But He brought His people out like sheep, and led them in the wilderness like a flock.

53.verse: He led them to safety, so they did not fear, but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.

54.verse: Then He brought them to His holy territory, to the mountain His right hand had gotten.

55.verse: He drove out nations before them, and allotted them an inheritance. He settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.

56.verse: Yet they tested and rebelled against El Elyon, and did not keep His decrees.

57.verse: Like their fathers they turned and were treacherous. They turned aside like a faulty bow.

58.verse: For they provoked Him with their high places, so they aroused His jealousy with their graven images.

59.verse: God heard and was furious, and He greatly detested Israel.

60.verse: He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent He pitched among men.

61.verse: He gave up His strength into captivity, and His glory into the adversary’s hand.

62.verse: He gave His people over to the sword, when He was angry at His inheritance.

63.verse: Fire consumed their young men, and their virgins had no wedding songs.

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.

65.verse: Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, as a warrior shaking off wine.

66.verse: He beat back His foes, putting them to lasting scorn.

67.verse: Then He detested Joseph’s tent and chose not the tribe of Ephraim.

68.verse: Instead He chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved.

69.verse: He built His Sanctuary like the heights, like the earth that He established forever.

70.verse: He also chose David His servant and took him from the sheepfolds,

71.verse: from following nursing ewes. He brought him to shepherd Jacob His people, and Israel His inheritance.

72.verse: So He shepherded them with the integrity of His heart, and led them with His skillful hands.

1.verse: A Lament Over Jerusalem Psalm 79 - A Psalm of Asaph. God, the nations have invaded Your inheritance, defiled Your holy Temple, and reduced Jerusalem to ruins.

2.verse: They gave the carcasses of Your servants as food to the birds of the skies, the flesh of Your kedoshim to the beasts of the earth.

3.verse: They poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there was no one to bury them.

4.verse: We have become a taunt to our neighbors, a scorn and derision to those around us.

5.verse: How long, ADONAI, will You be angry? Forever? Will Your jealousy keep blazing like fire?

6.verse: Pour out Your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge You, on the kingdoms that do not call on Your name.

7.verse: For they have devoured Jacob and laid waste his country.

8.verse: Do not hold against us the sins of our fathers. May Your mercies come quickly to meet us, for we are brought very low.

9.verse: Help us, God of our salvation— for the sake of the glory of Your Name. Deliver us, and atone for our sins— for Your name’s sake.

10.verse: Why should the nations say: “Where is their God?” Before our eyes, let it be known among the nations that You avenge the shed blood of Your servants.

11.verse: Let the prisoner’s groan come to You. By Your great arm preserve those who are doomed to die.

12.verse: Pay back into the midst of our neighbors sevenfold their reproach— the reproach they hurled at You, my Lord.

13.verse: So we, Your people, the flock of Your pasture, will praise You forever. From generation to generation we will recount Your praise.

1.verse: Restore Us, Revive Us Psalm 80 - For the music director, on “Lilies,” a testimony: a psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: Give ear, Shepherd of Israel, You who lead Joseph like a flock. You who are enthroned upon the cheruvim, shine forth!

3.verse: Before Ephraim, Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up Your might, and come to save us.

4.verse: O God, restore us, make Your face shine, and we will be saved.

5.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot, how long will You be angry with the prayer of Your people?

6.verse: You have fed them the bread of tears and made them drink a measure of tears.

7.verse: You make us a contention to our neighbors, and our enemies mock as they please.

8.verse: Elohei-Tzva’ot, restore us, and make Your face shine, and we will be saved.

9.verse: You pulled out a vine from Egypt. You drove out nations and planted it.

10.verse: You cleared a place for it, and it took deep root and filled the land.

11.verse: The mountains were covered by its shade, the mighty cedars with its branches.

12.verse: It sent out its branches to the sea, and its shoots to the river.

13.verse: Why have You broken down its fences, so all who pass by the way pick its fruit?

14.verse: A boar from the forest ravages it, whatever moves in the field feeds on it.

15.verse: Elohei-Tzva’ot, please return! Look down from heaven and see! Now take care of this vine—

16.verse: the shoot Your right hand planted— the son You strengthened for Yourself.

17.verse: It is burned with fire, it is cut down. They perish from the rebuke of Your face.

18.verse: Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand— the son of man You made strong for Yourself.

19.verse: Then we will not turn away from You. Revive us, and we will call on Your Name.

1.verse: Hear O Israel Psalm 81 - For the music director, on the Gittite lyre, of Asaph.

2.verse: Sing for joy to God our strength, shout to the God of Jacob!

3.verse: Lift up a song and sound a tambourine, a sweet lyre with a harp.

4.verse: Blow the shofar at the New Moon, at the full moon for the day of our festival.

5.verse: For it is a decree for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

6.verse: He set it up as a testimony in Joseph, when He went throughout the land of Egypt, I heard a language I did not understand.

7.verse: “I relieved his shoulder of the burden, his hands were set free from the basket.

8.verse: You called out in trouble, and I rescued you. I answered you from the hiding place of thunder. I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah

9.verse: Hear, My people, I will admonish you— if you would listen to Me, O Israel!

10.verse: Let there be no foreign god among you, and you shall not worship any alien god.

11.verse: I am ADONAI your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide and I will fill it.

12.verse: But My people did not listen to My voice. Israel was not willing to be Mine.

13.verse: So I gave them over to the stubbornness of their heart, to walk in their own counsels.

14.verse: Oh that My people would listen to Me, that Israel would walk in My ways!

15.verse: I would soon subdue their enemies, and turn My hand against their foes.

16.verse: Those who hate ADONAI would cringe before Him— their time of doom would be forever.

1.verse: A Rebuke for Unjust Judges Psalm 82 - A psalm of Asaph. God takes His stand in the assembly of God. He judges among the ‘gods’:

2.verse: “How long will you judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? Selah

3.verse: Give justice to the poor and fatherless. Be just to the afflicted and destitute.

4.verse: Rescue the weak and needy. Deliver them out of the hand of the wicked.

5.verse: They know nothing; they understand nothing— they walk about in darkness. All of earth’s foundations are shaken.

6.verse: I said: ‘You are ‘gods’, and you are all sons of Elyon,

7.verse: yet you will die like men, and will fall like any of the princes.’”

8.verse: Arise, O God, judge the earth! For You possess all the nations.

1.verse: Nations Conspire Against Israel Psalm 83 - A song: a psalm of Asaph.

2.verse: God, do not keep silent. Do not hold Your peace, O God. Do not be still.

3.verse: For look, Your enemies make an uproar. Those who hate You lift up their head.

4.verse: They make a shrewd plot against Your people, conspiring against Your treasured ones.

5.verse: “Come,” they say, “let’s wipe them out as a nation! Let Israel’s name be remembered no more!”

6.verse: For with one mind they plot together. Against You do they make a covenant.

7.verse: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,

8.verse: Gebal, Ammon and Amalek, Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre,

9.verse: even Assyria has joined them, becoming a strong arm for Lot’s sons. Selah

10.verse: Do to them as You did to Midian, to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River,

11.verse: who perished at En-dor— they became as dung for the ground.

12.verse: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb— all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

13.verse: who said, “Let us take possession of the pasturelands of God.”

14.verse: My God, make them like tumbleweed, like chaff before the wind.

15.verse: As a fire burns a forest, and as a flame sets mountains ablaze,

16.verse: so pursue them with Your tempest, and terrify them with Your storm.

17.verse: Cover their faces with shame, so they may seek Your Name—ADONAI.

18.verse: Let them be ashamed and dismayed forever. Let them be humiliated and perish.

1.verse: Pilgrim Road to ADONAI’s Courts Psalm 84 - For the music director, upon the Gittite lyre, a psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: How lovely are Your tabernacles, ADONAI-Tzva’ot!

3.verse: My soul yearns, even faints, for the courts of ADONAI. My heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.

4.verse: Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she may lay her young —near Your altars, ADONAI-Tzva’ot— my King and my God!

5.verse: Blessed are they who dwell in Your House —they are ever praising You. Selah

6.verse: Blessed is one whose strength is in You, in whose heart are the pilgrim roads.

7.verse: Passing through the valley of Baca, they make it a spring. The early rain covers it with blessings.

8.verse: They go from strength to strength— every one of them appears before God in Zion.

9.verse: ADONAI-Tzva’ot, hear my prayer, give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah

10.verse: O God, look at our shield, and look upon the face of Your anointed.

11.verse: For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand anywhere else. I would rather stand at the threshold of the House of my God than dwell in the tents of wickedness.

12.verse: For ADONAI Elohim is a sun and a shield. ADONAI gives grace and glory. No good thing will He withhold from those who walk uprightly.

1.verse: Restore Your People from Captivity Psalm 85 - For the music director, a psalm of the sons of Korah.

2.verse: ADONAI, will you favor Your land? Will You restore Jacob from captivity?

3.verse: Will You bear away Your people’s iniquity, Will You pardon all their sin? Selah

4.verse: Will You withdraw all Your wrath? Will You turn from Your burning anger?

5.verse: Restore us, O God of our salvation, and renounce Your indignation with us.

6.verse: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You prolong Your anger from generation to generation?

7.verse: Will You not revive us again, so Your people may rejoice in You?

8.verse: Show us Your mercy, ADONAI, and grant us Your salvation.

9.verse: Let me hear what God ADONAI will say. For He will speak shalom to His people, and to His kedoshim— but let them not turn back to folly.

10.verse: Surely His salvation is near those who fear Him, so that glory may dwell in our land.

11.verse: Lovingkindness and truth meet together. Righteousness and shalom kiss each other.

12.verse: Truth will spring up from the earth, and justice will look down from heaven.

13.verse: Yes, ADONAI will give what is good, and our land will yield its produce.

1.verse: Slow to Anger, Full of Chesed Psalm 86 - A prayer of David. Turn Your ear, ADONAI, and answer me, for I am weak and needy.

2.verse: Watch over my soul, for I am godly. You are my God— save Your servant who trusts in You.

3.verse: Be gracious to me, my Lord, for to You I cry all day.

4.verse: Gladden the soul of Your servant, for to You, my Lord, I lift up my soul.

5.verse: For You, my Lord, are good, and ready to forgive and full of mercy to all who call upon You.

6.verse: Give ear, ADONAI, to my prayer, listen to the voice of my supplications.

7.verse: In the day of my trouble I call upon You, for You will answer me.

8.verse: There is none like You among the gods, my Lord, there are no deeds like Yours.

9.verse: All nations You have made will come and bow down before You, my Lord, and they will glorify Your Name.

10.verse: For You are great, and do wonders— You alone are God.

11.verse: Teach me Your way, ADONAI, that I may walk in Your truth. Give me an undivided heart to fear Your Name.

12.verse: I praise You, O Lord my God, with my whole heart, and glorify Your Name forever.

13.verse: For great is Your lovingkindness toward me. You have delivered my soul from the lowest part of Sheol.

14.verse: God, the proud have risen up against me and a gang of ruthless people have sought my life, and have not set You before them.

15.verse: But You, my Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, full of love and truth.

16.verse: Turn to me and be gracious to me. Give Your strength to Your servant, and save the son of Your maidservant.

17.verse: Make me a sign for good, so that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed. For You, ADONAI, have helped me and comforted me.

1.verse: This One Was Born in Zion Psalm 87 - A psalm of the sons of Korah, a song. His foundation is in the holy mountains.

2.verse: ADONAI loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

3.verse: Glorious things are spoken of you, city of God. Selah

4.verse: “I will mention Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge Me— behold Philistia and Tyre, with Cush: ‘This one was born there.’”

5.verse: But of Zion it will be said: “This one and that one were born in her.” And Elyon Himself will establish her.

6.verse: ADONAI will count in the register of the peoples: “This one was born there.” Selah

7.verse: Then singing and dancing— all my fountains of joy are in you!

1.verse: Cry of Desperation Psalm 88 - A song, a psalm of the sons of Korah, for the music director, for singing Mahalath, a contemplative song of Heman the Ezrahite.

2.verse: ADONAI, God of my salvation, day and night I cried out before You.

3.verse: Let my prayer come before You. Turn Your ear to my cry.

4.verse: For my soul is full of troubles, and my life draws near to Sheol.

5.verse: I am counted with those who go down into the Pit. I have become as one with no strength—

6.verse: abandoned among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom You remember no more— cut off from Your hand.

7.verse: You have laid me in the lowest places, in dark places, in the depths.

8.verse: Your wrath lies heavily on me. You afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah

9.verse: You have put my companions far from me. You have made me repulsive to them. I am shut in and I cannot go out.

10.verse: My eye fails from affliction. I call upon You every day, ADONAI. I spread out my hands to You.

11.verse: Will You work wonders for the dead? Or will the departed spirits rise up praising You? Selah

12.verse: Will Your love be declared in the grave? Or Your faithfulness in the place of ruin?

13.verse: Will Your wonders be known in the darkness? Your righteousness in the land of oblivion?

14.verse: But I—I cried out to You, ADONAI, and in the morning my prayer meets You.

15.verse: ADONAI, why do You spurn me? Why do You hide Your face from me?

16.verse: From my youth I have been afflicted and close to death. I suffer Your terrors—I am desperate!

17.verse: Your fury has swept over me. Your terrors have cut me off.

18.verse: Like water they surge around me all day. They close in on me together.

1.verse: Covenant with David’s Seed Psalm 89 - A contemplative song of Ethan the Ezrahite.

2.verse: I will sing of the love of ADONAI forever. To all generations I will make known Your faithfulness with my mouth.

3.verse: For I said, “Let your lovingkindness be built up forever! The heavens—let Your faithfulness be made firm there!”

4.verse: “I have made a covenant with My chosen one. I have sworn to David My servant:

5.verse: ‘Forever I will establish your seed, and will build your throne from generation to generation.’” Selah

6.verse: The heavens praise Your wonders, ADONAI —Your faithfulness, too— in the assembly of the kedoshim.

7.verse: For who in the skies can compare to ADONAI? Who is like ADONAI among the sons of gods?

8.verse: God is greatly feared in the council of the holy ones, and awesome above all around Him.

9.verse: ADONAI Elohei-Tzva’ot, who is like You, mighty ADONAI, with Your faithfulness all around You?

10.verse: You rule over the swelling of the sea. When its waves mount up, You still them.

11.verse: You crushed Rahab like a slain one. You scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.

12.verse: The heavens are Yours, also Yours the earth —the world and its fullness— You have founded them.

13.verse: You created the north and the south. Tabor and Hermon sing for joy at Your Name.

14.verse: Your arm is mighty, Your hand is strong, exalted is Your right hand.

15.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne. Lovingkindness and truth go before You.

16.verse: Blessed are the people who know the joyful shout, They walk in the light of Your presence, ADONAI.

17.verse: They rejoice in Your Name all day, and by Your righteousness they are exalted.

18.verse: For You are the glory of their strength, and by Your favor our horn is exalted.

19.verse: For our shield belongs to ADONAI, and our king to the Holy One of Israel.

20.verse: Then You spoke in vision to Your godly ones, and said: “I have bestowed help on a warrior. I have exalted one chosen from among the people.

21.verse: I have found David My servant. With My holy oil I have anointed him.

22.verse: With him My hand will be established. Surely My arm will strengthen him.

23.verse: No enemy will exact tribute from him, no son of wickedness will oppress him.

24.verse: I will crush his adversaries before him, and strike down those who hate him.

25.verse: My faithfulness and My lovingkindness will be with him, and by My Name his horn will be exalted.

26.verse: I will also set his hand over the sea, his right hand over the rivers.

27.verse: He will call to Me: ‘You are my Father, my God and the rock of my salvation.’

28.verse: I also will set him as firstborn— the highest of the kings of earth.

29.verse: I will maintain My love for him forever, and My covenant with him will be firm.

30.verse: His seed I will establish forever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

31.verse: If his sons forsake My Torah, and do not walk in My judgments,

32.verse: if they violate My decrees, and do not keep My mitzvot,

33.verse: then I will punish their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with flogging.

34.verse: But I will not withdraw My lovingkindness from him, nor will I betray My faithfulness.

35.verse: I will not violate My covenant, nor alter what My lips have uttered.

36.verse: Once for all I have sworn by My holiness —surely I will not lie to David—

37.verse: his descendants will endure forever, and his throne as the sun before Me,

38.verse: and as the moon, established forever, and a trustworthy witness in the sky.” Selah

39.verse: But You have cast off and spurned, You have become furious with Your anointed one.

40.verse: You have renounced the covenant of Your servant. You have defiled his crown even to the ground.

41.verse: You have broken down all his walls. You reduced his strongholds to ruin.

42.verse: All who pass by have plundered him. He has become a taunt to his neighbors.

43.verse: You exalted the right hand of his foes and made all his enemies rejoice.

44.verse: You turned back the edge of his sword and have not supported him in battle.

45.verse: You brought his splendor to an end, and cast his throne down to the ground.

46.verse: You cut short the days of his youth. You covered him with shame. Selah

47.verse: How long, ADONAI, will You hide Yourself? Forever? Will Your fury keep burning like fire?

48.verse: Remember how short my life span is! For what futility have You created all the children of men?

49.verse: What man can live and not see death? Can he deliver himself from the clutches of Sheol? Selah

50.verse: Where is Your former lovingkindness, my Lord, which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?

51.verse: Remember, my Lord, the mockery against Your servants that I bear in my heart from so many peoples.

52.verse: How Your enemies have mocked, ADONAI, how they have mocked the footsteps of Your Anointed One!

1.verse: Get a Heart of Wisdom Psalm 90 - A prayer of Moses the man of God. My Lord, You have been our dwelling from generation to generation.

2.verse: Before the mountains were born, or You gave birth to the earth and the world, even from everlasting to everlasting, You are God!

3.verse: You turn mankind back to dust, saying, “Return, children of Adam!”

4.verse: For a thousand years in Your sight are like a day just passing by, or like a watch in the night.

5.verse: You sweep them away in their sleep. In the morning they are like sprouting grass—

6.verse: in the morning it flourishes and springs up, by evening it withers and dries up.

7.verse: For we are consumed by Your anger and terrified by Your wrath.

8.verse: You have set our iniquities before You, our secret sins in the light of Your presence.

9.verse: For all our days have passed away under Your wrath. We spent our years like a sigh.

10.verse: The span of our years is seventy —or with strength, eighty— yet at best they are trouble and sorrow. For they are soon gone, and we fly away.

11.verse: Who knows the power of Your anger? Your fury leads to awe of you.

12.verse: So teach us to number our days, so that we may get a heart of wisdom.

13.verse: Relent, ADONAI! How long? Have compassion on Your servants.

14.verse: Satisfy us in the morning with Your love, so we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.

15.verse: Gladden us for as many days as You have humbled us, as many years as we have seen misery.

16.verse: Let Your work appear to Your servants, and Your splendor on their children.

17.verse: Let the favor of the Lord our God be upon us. Establish the work of our hands for us— yes, establish the work of our hands.

1.verse: Dwell in the Shelter of Elyon Psalm 91 - He who dwells in the shelter of Elyon, will abide in the shadow of Shaddai.

2.verse: I will say of ADONAI, “He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.

3.verse: For He will rescue you from the hunter’s trap and from the deadly pestilence.

4.verse: He will cover you with His feathers, and under His wings you will find refuge. His faithfulness is body armor and shield.

5.verse: You will not fear the terror by night, nor the arrow that flies by day,

6.verse: nor the plague that stalks in darkness, nor the scourge that lays waste at noon.

7.verse: A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not come near you.

8.verse: You will only look on with your eyes and see the wicked paid back.

9.verse: For you have made Elyon your dwelling, even ADONAI, who is my refuge,

10.verse: so no evil will befall you nor any plague come near your tent.

11.verse: For He will give His angels charge over you, to guard you in all your ways.

12.verse: Upon their hands they will lift you up, lest you strike your foot against a stone.

13.verse: You will tread upon the lion and cobra, trample the young lion and serpent.

14.verse: “Because he has devoted his love to Me, I will deliver him. I will set him securely on high, because he knows My Name.

15.verse: When he calls on Me, I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble, rescue him, and honor him.

16.verse: With long life will I satisfy him and show him My salvation.”

1.verse: It Is Good to Praise Psalm 92 - A psalm, a song for the Shabbat.

2.verse: It is good to praise ADONAI and to make music to Your Name, Elyon,

3.verse: to declare Your love in the morning and Your faithfulness at night,

4.verse: with a ten-string harp, with resounding music on the lyre.

5.verse: For You made me glad, ADONAI, by Your deeds. I sing for joy at the works of Your hands.

6.verse: How great are Your works, ADONAI! How profound are Your thoughts!

7.verse: A brutish man does not know, nor does a fool understand.

8.verse: Though the wicked spring up like grass, and all evildoers flourish, it is only to be ruined forever.

9.verse: But You, ADONAI, are exalted forever.

10.verse: For behold, Your enemies, ADONAI —behold Your enemies perish— all evildoers are scattered.

11.verse: But You exalted my horn like that of a wild ox. I am anointed with fresh oil.

12.verse: My eye can gaze on those lying in wait for me. My ears hear about evildoers rising up against me.

13.verse: The righteous will flourish like a palm tree. He will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

14.verse: Planted in the House of ADONAI, they will flourish in the courts of our God.

15.verse: They will still yield fruit in old age. They will be full of sap and freshness.

1.verse: Majestic and Unshakable Psalm 93 - ADONAI reigns—He is robed in majesty! ADONAI has robed and armed Himself with strength. Yes, the world is firmly established—unshakable.

2.verse: Your throne is established from of old. You are from everlasting.

3.verse: The floods have lifted up, ADONAI, the floods have lifted up their voice, the floods lift up their crashing waves.

4.verse: More than the sounds of many waters— more majestic than the breakers of the sea— so majestic is ADONAI on high!

5.verse: Your testimonies are very sure. Holiness befits Your House, ADONAI, for endless days.

1.verse: He Will Not Abandon His People Psalm 94 - God of vengeance, ADONAI, God of vengeance, shine forth!

2.verse: Rise up, O Judge of the earth! Pay back to the proud what they deserve.

3.verse: How long will the wicked, ADONAI, how long will the wicked gloat?

4.verse: They gush out, they speak arrogance— all the evildoers keep boasting.

5.verse: They crush Your people, ADONAI, and afflict Your heritage.

6.verse: They slay the widow and the outsider, and murder the fatherless.

7.verse: So they say: “ADONAI does not see— the God of Jacob pays no attention.”

8.verse: Pay attention, stupid among the people! Fools, when will you comprehend?

9.verse: He who planted the ear, does He not hear? He who formed the eye, does He not see?

10.verse: He who chastens nations, will He not rebuke— One who teaches humanity knowledge?

11.verse: ADONAI knows human thoughts— they are but a breath.

12.verse: Blessed is the one You discipline, ADONAI, and teach him from Your Torah,

13.verse: to give him rest from days of trouble —until a pit is dug for the wicked.

14.verse: For ADONAI will not forsake His people. He will never abandon His inheritance.

15.verse: For rightness will be restored to justice, and all the upright in heart will follow it.

16.verse: Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will stand up for me against evildoers?

17.verse: Unless ADONAI had been my help, my soul would soon have dwelt in the abode of silence.

18.verse: If I say: “My foot has slipped,” Your mercy, ADONAI, will hold me up.

19.verse: When my troubling thoughts multiply within me, Your consolations comfort my soul.

20.verse: Can a throne of corruption be aligned with You—planning distress by decree?

21.verse: They band together against the life of the righteous, and condemn innocent blood.

22.verse: But ADONAI has been my fortress and my God the rock of my refuge.

23.verse: He will repay them for their wickedness, and will annihilate them in their evil. ADONAI our God will annihilate them.

1.verse: Today, Hear His Voice Psalm 95 - O come, let us sing for joy to ADONAI. Let us shout for joy to the rock of our salvation.

2.verse: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving. Let us shout joyfully to Him with songs.

3.verse: For ADONAI is a great God and a great King above all gods.

4.verse: In His hand are the depths of the earth, the mountain peaks are His also.

5.verse: The sea is His—He made it, and His hands formed the dry land.

6.verse: Come, let us worship and bow down. Let us kneel before ADONAI our Maker.

7.verse: For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture, the flock of His hand. Today, if you hear His voice:

8.verse: “Do not harden your heart as at Meribah, as in the day of Massah in the wilderness,

9.verse: when your fathers tested Me, they challenged Me, even though they had seen My work.

10.verse: For forty years I loathed that generation. So I said: ‘It is a people whose heart goes astray, who do not know My ways.’

11.verse: Therefore I swore in My anger, ‘They shall never enter into My rest.’”

1.verse: Sing a New Song Psalm 96 - Sing to ADONAI a new song! Sing to ADONAI, all the earth.

2.verse: Sing to ADONAI, bless His Name. Proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.

3.verse: Declare His glory among the nations, His marvelous deeds among all peoples.

4.verse: For great is ADONAI, and greatly to be praised. He is to be feared above all gods.

5.verse: For all the gods of the peoples are idols, but ADONAI made the heavens.

6.verse: Splendor and majesty are before Him. Strength and beauty are in His Sanctuary.

7.verse: Ascribe to ADONAI, O families of peoples. Ascribe to ADONAI glory and strength.

8.verse: Ascribe to ADONAI the glory of His Name. Bring an offering and come into His courts.

9.verse: Bow down to ADONAI in holy splendor. Tremble before Him, all the earth.

10.verse: Say among the nations: “ADONAI reigns!” The world is firmly established—it will not move. He will judge the peoples with fairness.

11.verse: Let the heavens be glad, let the earth rejoice. Let the sea roar—and all that fills it.

12.verse: Let the land exult—and all that is in it. Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy—

13.verse: before ADONAI, for He is coming! For He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples in His faithfulness.

1.verse: Exalted Above All Gods Psalm 97 - ADONAI reigns, let the earth rejoice, let the many islands be glad.

2.verse: Clouds and darkness are all around Him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.

3.verse: Fire goes before Him and burns up His adversaries on every side.

4.verse: His lightning lights up the world— the earth sees and trembles.

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of ADONAI, at the presence of the Lord of all earth.

6.verse: The heavens declare His righteousness, and all the peoples have seen His glory.

7.verse: Let all who serve graven images be ashamed—who boast in idols. Bow down before Him, all you gods!

8.verse: Zion hears and is glad, and the daughters of Judah rejoice, because of Your judgments, ADONAI.

9.verse: For You, ADONAI, are Elyon above all the earth. You are exalted far above all gods.

10.verse: You who love ADONAI, hate evil! He watches over the souls of His godly ones. He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.

11.verse: Light is sown for the righteous and gladness for the upright in heart.

12.verse: Rejoice in ADONAI, you righteous ones, and praise His holy Name.

1.verse: Creation Rejoices in His Salvation Psalm 98 - A psalm. Sing to ADONAI a new song, for He has done marvelous things. His right hand and His holy arm have won victory for Him.

2.verse: ADONAI has made His salvation known. He has revealed His righteousness before the eyes of the nations.

3.verse: He has remembered His lovingkindness, His faithfulness to the house of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.

4.verse: Shout joyfully to ADONAI, all the earth. Break forth, sing for joy, and sing praises.

5.verse: Sing praises to ADONAI with the harp, with the harp and a voice of melody.

6.verse: With trumpets and sound of the shofar blast a sound before the King, ADONAI.

7.verse: Let the sea roar and all within it, the world and those who dwell in it.

8.verse: Let the rivers clap their hands, let the mountains sing for joy together—

9.verse: before ADONAI, for He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with fairness.

1.verse: Worship at His Holy Hill Psalm 99 - ADONAI reigns, let the peoples tremble. He is enthroned upon the cheruvim—let the earth shake!

2.verse: ADONAI is great in Zion and He is exalted above all the peoples.

3.verse: Let them praise Your great and awesome Name: holy is He.

4.verse: The might of a king loves justice. You have established fairness. You executed justice and righteousness in Jacob.

5.verse: Exalt ADONAI our God and worship at His footstool: holy is He.

6.verse: Moses and Aaron were among His kohanim— also Samuel among those calling on His Name. They called on ADONAI and He answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud. They kept His testimonies, and the decree that He gave them.

8.verse: ADONAI our God, You answered them. A forgiving God You were to them, though You avenged their misdeeds.

9.verse: Exalt ADONAI our God, and worship at His holy hill, for holy is ADONAI our God.

1.verse: Enter His Gates with Thanksgiving Psalm 100 - A psalm of thanksgiving. Shout joyfully to ADONAI, all the earth!

2.verse: Serve ADONAI with gladness. Come before His presence with joyful singing.

3.verse: Know that ADONAI, He is God. It is He who has made us, and we are His. We are His people, the sheep of His pasture.

4.verse: Enter His gates with thanksgiving and His courts with praise! Praise Him, bless His Name.

5.verse: For ADONAI is good. His lovingkindness endures forever, and His faithfulness to all generations.

1.verse: Pledge of Integrity Psalm 101 - A psalm of David. I will sing of lovingkindness and justice. To You, ADONAI, I will sing praises.

2.verse: I will behave wisely in the way of integrity —when will You come to me? I walk in my house with integrity in my heart.

3.verse: No base thing will I set before my eyes. Twisted behavior I hate—it will not cling to me.

4.verse: A perverse heart will depart from me. I will know nothing evil.

5.verse: Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret —him I will silence. Who has haughty eyes and a proud heart —him I will not tolerate.

6.verse: My eyes are on the trustworthy of the land, to be in my company. One walking in a blameless way will serve me.

7.verse: No one who practices deceit will dwell in my house. No one who utters lies will endure before my eyes.

8.verse: Each morning I silence all the land’s wicked ones— to cut off from ADONAI’s city every evildoer.

1.verse: Prayer in Affliction Psalm 102 - A prayer of the afflicted one, when he is faint and pours out his lament before ADONAI:

2.verse: ADONAI, hear my prayer, let my cry come to You.

3.verse: Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my distress. Turn Your ear to me—in the day I call, answer me quickly.

4.verse: For my days vanished like smoke, and my bones were burned like coals.

5.verse: My heart is stricken and withered like grass, so that I even forget to eat my bread.

6.verse: Because of the sound of my groaning, my bones cling to my flesh.

7.verse: I am like a pelican of the desert, like an owl of the waste places.

8.verse: I lie awake, like a lonely bird on a roof.

9.verse: My enemies taunt me all day. My deriders use my name to curse.

10.verse: For I have eaten ashes like bread, and mixed my drink with tears—

11.verse: because of Your indignation and wrath, for You have picked me up and tossed me aside.

12.verse: My days are like a lengthening shadow, and I wither away like grass.

13.verse: But You, ADONAI, sit enthroned forever. Your renown is from generation to generation.

14.verse: You will arise and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show favor to her, for the appointed time has come,

15.verse: for her stones are dear to Your servants, and they cherish her dust.

16.verse: So the nations will fear ADONAI’s Name and all the kings of the earth Your glory.

17.verse: For ADONAI has rebuilt Zion. He has appeared in His glory.

18.verse: He has turned to the prayer of the destitute, and has not despised their prayer.

19.verse: Let it be written for a generation to come, that a people to be created may praise ADONAI.

20.verse: For He looks down from His holy height, from heaven ADONAI gazes on the earth,

21.verse: to hear the groaning of the prisoner, to set free those condemned to death,

22.verse: to declare the Name of ADONAI in Zion and His praise in Jerusalem,

23.verse: when the peoples and the kingdoms assemble to worship ADONAI.

24.verse: He brought down my strength in midcourse. He shortened my days.

25.verse: I say, “My God, do not take me up in the middle of my days. Your years endure through all generations!

26.verse: Long ago You founded the earth, the heavens are the work of Your hands.

27.verse: They will perish, but You will remain. All of them will wear out like a garment. Like clothing You change them, so they change.

28.verse: But You are the same, and Your years will never end.

1.verse: As a Father Has Compassion Psalm 103 - Of David. Bless ADONAI, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless His holy Name.

2.verse: Bless ADONAI, O my soul, and forget not all His benefits:

3.verse: He forgives all your iniquity. He heals all your diseases.

4.verse: He redeems your life from the Pit. He crowns you with lovingkindness and compassions.

5.verse: He satisfies your years with good things, so that your youth is renewed like an eagle.

6.verse: ADONAI executes justice— judgments for all who are oppressed.

7.verse: He made His ways known to Moses, His deeds to the children of Israel.

8.verse: ADONAI is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, and plentiful in mercy.

9.verse: He will not always accuse, nor will He keep His anger forever.

10.verse: He has not treated us according to our sins, or repaid us according to our iniquities.
