11.verse: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is His mercy for those who fear Him.

12.verse: As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.

13.verse: As a father has compassion on his children, so ADONAI has compassion on those who fear Him.

14.verse: For He knows our frame. He remembers that we are but dust.

15.verse: As for man, his days are like grass— he flourishes like a flower of the field,

16.verse: but when the wind blows over it, it is gone, and its place is no longer known.

17.verse: But the mercy of ADONAI is from everlasting to everlasting on those who revere Him, His righteousness to children’s children,

18.verse: to those who keep His covenant, who remember to observe His instructions.

19.verse: ADONAI has set up His throne in the heavens, and His kingdom rules over all.

20.verse: Bless ADONAI, you angels of His: mighty in strength, performing His word, upon hearing the utterance of His word.

21.verse: Bless ADONAI, all you His armies, His servants who do His will.

22.verse: Bless ADONAI, all His works everywhere in His dominion. Bless ADONAI, O my soul!

1.verse: ADONAI Rejoices in His Works! Psalm 104 - Bless ADONAI, O my soul. ADONAI my God, You are very great! You are clothed with splendor and majesty—

2.verse: wrapping Yourself in light as a robe, stretching out heaven like a curtain,

3.verse: laying beams for His upper rooms in waters, making the clouds His chariot, walking on the wings of the wind,

4.verse: making His angels spirits, His servants a flaming fire.

5.verse: He set the earth upon its foundations, so it should not totter forever and ever.

6.verse: You covered it with the deep as with a garment— the waters standing above the mountains.

7.verse: At Your rebuke the waters fled. At the sound of Your thunder they hurried away.

8.verse: The waters go up the mountains, then down to the valleys— to the place that You assigned to them.

9.verse: You set a boundary to the waters that they may not cross over, so they may not return to cover the earth.

10.verse: You make springs gush into the valleys. They run between the mountains.

11.verse: They give drink to all the beasts of the field— the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

12.verse: Beside them the birds of the sky dwell— they sing among the branches.

13.verse: He waters mountains from His upper rooms. The earth is full of the fruit of Your labors.

14.verse: He causes grass to spring up for the cattle, and vegetation for man to cultivate, to bring forth bread out of the earth,

15.verse: wine that makes man’s heart glad, oil to make his face shine, and bread that sustains man’s heart.

16.verse: The trees of ADONAI are satisfied, the cedars of Lebanon that He planted,

17.verse: where birds make their nests, and the stork—her home is the fir trees.

18.verse: The high mountains are for wild goats, the cliffs a refuge for rock badgers.

19.verse: He made the moon for appointed times, the sun knows its going down.

20.verse: You bring darkness, so it becomes night, when all the beasts of the forest prowl.

21.verse: The young lions roar for prey, seeking their food from God.

22.verse: But when the sun rises, they gather and lie down in their dens.

23.verse: Man goes out to his work, and to his labor until the evening.

24.verse: ADONAI, how countless are Your works! In wisdom You made them all— the earth is full of Your creatures.

25.verse: There is the sea, vast and wide, teeming with gliding things innumerable, living creatures, both small and large.

26.verse: There, ships go to and fro. Leviathan—You formed to frolic there.

27.verse: They all look to You to give them their food at the right time.

28.verse: When You give it to them, they gather it up. When You open Your hand, they are satisfied with good.

29.verse: But when You hide Your face—they are dismayed. You take away their breath—they perish, and return to their dust.

30.verse: You send forth Your Ruach—they are created, and You renew the face of the earth.

31.verse: May the glory of ADONAI endure forever! May ADONAI rejoice in His works!

32.verse: He looks at the earth, and it trembles. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.

33.verse: I will sing to ADONAI as long as I live! I will sing praise to my God yet again!

34.verse: Let my meditation be sweet to Him. I—I will rejoice in ADONAI.

35.verse: Let sinners vanish from the earth and let the wicked be no more. Bless ADONAI, O my soul. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Tell His Wonders for Israel Psalm 105 - Praise ADONAI, call upon His Name. Make known His deeds among the peoples.

2.verse: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him— tell about all His wonders!

3.verse: Glory in His holy Name. Let the heart of those who seek ADONAI rejoice.

4.verse: Seek ADONAI and His strength, seek His face always.

5.verse: Remember His wonders that He has done, His miracles and the judgments of His mouth,

6.verse: O seed of Abraham, His servant, O children of Jacob, His chosen ones.

7.verse: He is ADONAI our God. His judgments are in all the earth.

8.verse: He remembers His covenant forever— the word He commanded for a thousand generations—

9.verse: which He made with Abraham, and swore to Isaac,

10.verse: and confirmed to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant,

11.verse: saying, “To you I give the land of Canaan, the portion of your inheritance.”

12.verse: When they were but few in number, few indeed, and foreigners in it,

13.verse: wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people,

14.verse: He allowed no one to oppress them— for their sake He rebuked kings:

15.verse: “Touch not My anointed ones, and do My prophets no harm.”

16.verse: He called down a famine on the land. He broke the whole supply of bread.

17.verse: He sent a man before them— Joseph, sold as a slave.

18.verse: They hurt His feet with shackles, he was put in irons—

19.verse: till the time that his word came true— the word of ADONAI proved him true!

20.verse: The king sent and released him. The ruler of the peoples set him free.

21.verse: He made him lord of his house, ruler over all his possessions,

22.verse: to discipline his princes at his will, and teach his elders wisdom.

23.verse: Then Israel came into Egypt, Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

24.verse: He made His people very fruitful, and made them more numerous than their foes.

25.verse: He turned their hearts to hate His people, to deal shrewdly with His servants.

26.verse: He sent Moses His servant, and Aaron, whom He had chosen.

27.verse: They performed His signs among them —miracles in the land of Ham.

28.verse: He sent darkness, and it was dark, so they did not rebel against His words.

29.verse: He turned their waters into blood, causing their fish to die.

30.verse: Their land swarmed with frogs, even in their royal chambers.

31.verse: He spoke, and a swarm of gnats came within all their borders.

32.verse: He gave them a rain of hail, flames of fire throughout their land.

33.verse: He struck their vines and their fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.

34.verse: He spoke, and the locust came —young locusts without number—

35.verse: to eat up every green thing in their land and eat up the fruit of their ground.

36.verse: Then He struck all the firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their vigor.

37.verse: Then He brought them out with silver and gold, and no one among His tribes faltered.

38.verse: Egypt was glad when they left— for dread of them had fallen on them.

39.verse: He spread a cloud as a covering and fire to give light at night.

40.verse: They asked, and He brought quail, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

41.verse: He opened a rock, and waters gushed out, flowed as a river in dry places.

42.verse: For He remembered His holy word to Abraham His servant.

43.verse: So He brought forth His people with joy, His chosen ones with singing.

44.verse: He gave them the lands of the nations, so they inherited the labor of the peoples

45.verse: so that they might keep His statutes and observe His laws. Halleluyah!

1.verse: ADONAI Still Faithful to Israel Psalm 106 - Halleluyah! Praise ADONAI, for He is good, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

2.verse: Who can speak of ADONAI’s mighty acts or declare His praise?

3.verse: Blessed are those who maintain justice, who do what is right at all times.

4.verse: Remember me, ADONAI, when You show favor to Your people. Visit me with Your salvation,

5.verse: so I may behold the prosperity of Your chosen ones, exult in the joy of Your nation, and give praise with Your inheritance.

6.verse: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have acted wickedly.

7.verse: Our fathers in Egypt did not ponder Your wonders. Nor did they remember Your abundant lovingkindness, but rebelled by the sea—at the Sea of Reeds.

8.verse: Yet He saved them for His Name’s sake, to make His mighty power known.

9.verse: He rebuked the Sea of Reeds and it dried up, and He led them through the depths as through a wilderness.

10.verse: So He saved them from the hand of those who hated them, redeemed them from the enemy’s hand.

11.verse: The waters covered their adversaries— not one of them was left.

12.verse: Then they believed His words. They were singing His praise.

13.verse: How quickly they forgot His works, and would not wait for His counsel!

14.verse: In the wilderness they craved ravenously, in the desert they tested God.

15.verse: So He gave them what they asked for, but sent a wasting disease among them.

16.verse: Then they envied Moses in the camp, and also Aaron, the holy one of ADONAI.

17.verse: The earth opened up, swallowed Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

18.verse: Also a fire blazed in their company, a flame consumed the wicked.

19.verse: They made a calf in Horeb and worshipped a molten image.

20.verse: Thus they exchanged their glory for an image of a grass-eating ox.

21.verse: They forgot God their Savior, who had done great things in Egypt—

22.verse: miracles in the land of Ham, awesome things by the Sea of Reeds.

23.verse: So He commanded their extermination, had not Moses, His chosen one, stood in the breach before Him, to turn His wrath from destroying them.

24.verse: Then they scorned the pleasing land— they did not trust in His word.

25.verse: Instead, they grumbled in their tents. They would not listen to ADONAI’s voice.

26.verse: Therefore He swore to them that He would make them fall in the desert,

27.verse: and disperse their offspring among the nations, and scatter them through the lands.

28.verse: Then they yoked themselves to Baal of Peor, and ate the sacrifices of dead things.

29.verse: So they provoked Him with their deeds, and a plague broke out among them.

30.verse: But Phinehas stood up and intervened, so the plague was stopped.

31.verse: It was credited to him as righteousness, from generation to generation forever.

32.verse: By the waters of Meribah they angered Him, and trouble came on Moses because of them.

33.verse: For they embittered his spirit and he spoke rashly with his lips.

34.verse: They did not destroy the peoples, as ADONAI had commanded them.

35.verse: Instead they mingled with the nations and learned their practices.

36.verse: They worshipped their idols, which became a snare to them.

37.verse: They even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.

38.verse: They shed innocent blood— the blood of their sons and their daughters, sacrificed to the idols of Canaan. So the land was desecrated with blood.

39.verse: So they defiled themselves by their deeds, and prostituted themselves by their practices.

40.verse: Therefore the anger of ADONAI was kindled against His people, and He abhorred His inheritance.

41.verse: He handed them to the nations— those who hated them ruled over them.

42.verse: Their enemies oppressed them, so they were subdued under their hand.

43.verse: Many times He delivered them, but they kept rebelling deliberately, and so sank low into their iniquity.

44.verse: Yet He saw their distress, when He heard their cry,

45.verse: remembered His covenant to them, and relented in the greatness of His mercy.

46.verse: He caused them to be pitied in the presence of all their captors.

47.verse: Save us, ADONAI our God, and gather us from the nations, so we may praise Your holy Name and triumph in Your praise.

48.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting! Let all the people say, “Amen!” Halleluyah!

1.verse: His Chesed and His Wonders Psalm 107 - Praise ADONAI, for He is good, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

2.verse: Let the redeemed of ADONAI say so— whom He redeemed from the hand of the foe,

3.verse: whom He gathered out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea.

4.verse: Some wandered in a desert, a wasteland. They found no way to an inhabited city.

5.verse: Hungry and thirsty, their souls ebbed away.

6.verse: So they cried out to ADONAI in their distress, and He delivered them out of their troubles.

7.verse: Then He led them by a straight way to go to a city where they could live.

8.verse: Let them praise ADONAI for His mercy and His wonders for the children of men,

9.verse: for He satisfies the thirsty soul and fills the hungry soul with goodness.

10.verse: Some sat in darkness and deep gloom, prisoners in misery and iron chains,

11.verse: for they had defied God’s words, and spurned the counsel of Elyon.

12.verse: So He humbled their heart with trouble. They stumbled, and no one was helping.

13.verse: So they cried out to ADONAI in their distress, and He delivered them out of their troubles.

14.verse: He brought them out of darkness and deep gloom, breaking their chains.

15.verse: Let them praise ADONAI for His mercy, and His wonders for the children of men,

16.verse: for He shattered bronze gates, and broke into pieces iron bars.

17.verse: Some became fools because of their rebellious ways, and were afflicted due to their iniquities.

18.verse: Their soul abhorred all food, and they drew near the gates of death.

19.verse: So they cried out to ADONAI in their distress, and He delivered them out of their troubles.

20.verse: He sent His word and healed them, and rescued them from their pits.

21.verse: Let them praise ADONAI for His mercy, and His wonders for the children of men.

22.verse: Let them sacrifice thank offerings and tell of His works with joyful singing.

23.verse: Some go out to the sea in ships, doing business on the mighty waters.

24.verse: They saw the works of ADONAI, and His wonders in the deep.

25.verse: For He spoke and raised a stormy wind, lifting up towering waves.

26.verse: They mounted up to the sky and plunged down to the depths. In their peril their souls melted away.

27.verse: They reeled and staggered like a drunk, and all their skill was bewildered.

28.verse: So they cried out to ADONAI in their distress, and He brought them out of their troubles.

29.verse: He stilled the storm to a whisper— the waves were hushed.

30.verse: They were glad when it became calm, and He led them to their desired haven.

31.verse: Let them praise ADONAI for His mercy, and His wonders to the children of men.

32.verse: Let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people, and praise Him at the assembly of elders.

33.verse: He turns rivers into a wilderness and springs of water into thirsty ground,

34.verse: and a fruitful land into a salt waste, because of the evil of its inhabitants.

35.verse: He turns a desert into a pool of water, a dry land into springs of water.

36.verse: There He brings the hungry to live, and they establish a city for a dwelling.

37.verse: So they sow fields and plant vineyards that yield a fruitful harvest.

38.verse: He blesses them, they multiply greatly, and He does not let their herds diminish,

39.verse: after they were few and crushed by oppression, calamity and sorrow.

40.verse: He pours contempt on princes, making them wander in trackless waste.

41.verse: But He lifts the needy high above affliction, and makes their families like a flock.

42.verse: The upright see it and are glad, and all iniquity shuts its mouth.

43.verse: Who is wise? Let him observe these things, and consider ADONAI’s lovingkindness.

1.verse: With God We Do Valiantly Psalm 108 - A song, a psalm of David.

2.verse: My heart is steadfast, O God. I will sing, sing praises with all my soul.

3.verse: Awake, harp and lyre— I will awaken the dawn!

4.verse: I will give thanks to You, ADONAI, among the peoples, I will sing praises to You among the nations.

5.verse: For Your love is higher than the heavens, Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

6.verse: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens, let Your glory be above all the earth.

7.verse: Let Your beloved ones be delivered. Save with Your right hand, answer me!

8.verse: God has spoken in His Sanctuary: “I will triumph! I will parcel out Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succot.

9.verse: Gilead is Mine, Manasseh is Mine. Also Ephraim is a helmet for My head, Judah is my scepter.

10.verse: Moab is My washbowl. I throw my shoe on Edom. I shout in triumph over Philistia.”

11.verse: Who will bring me into the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?

12.verse: O God, have You not spurned us? Will You go out no more with our armies?

13.verse: Give us help against the adversary— for useless is deliverance through man.

1.verse: Prayer Against an Accuser Psalm 109 - For the music director, a psalm of David. O God of my praise, be not silent.

2.verse: For the wicked and the deceitful have opened their mouth against me. They spoke to me with a lying tongue,

3.verse: with hateful words surrounded me, and fought against me without cause.

4.verse: In return for my love they are my accusers, but I am in prayer.

5.verse: They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

6.verse: Set a wicked man over him, let an accuser stand at his right hand.

7.verse: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, and may his prayer be as sin.

8.verse: Let his days be few, let another take his position.

9.verse: May his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

10.verse: Let his children wander and beg and may they search in their ruins.

11.verse: Let a creditor seize all he has, and may strangers plunder his labor.

12.verse: Let no one show him mercy, or take pity on his fatherless children.

13.verse: Let his posterity be cut off, and his name be blotted out in the next generation.

14.verse: May the guilt of his fathers be remembered before ADONAI, the sin of his mother never blotted out.

15.verse: Let their sins be before ADONAI continually, that He may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

16.verse: For he never remembered to show mercy. But he persecuted a poor and needy man, crushed in spirit, to put him to death.

17.verse: How he loved cursing— may it fall on him! He had no pleasure in blessing— may it be far from him!

18.verse: He wore cursing like his robe, until it filled his belly like water, and his bones like oil.

19.verse: May it be like a cloak wrapped around him, like a belt tied around him always.

20.verse: Let this be ADONAI’s reward to my accusers, and to those who speak evil against me.

21.verse: But You, ADONAI my Lord, deal with me for Your Name’s sake. Because Your lovingkindness is good, deliver me.

22.verse: For I am afflicted and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

23.verse: I fade away like an evening shadow, shaken off like a locust.

24.verse: My knees totter from fasting, and my flesh is lean, with no fat.

25.verse: And I have become a taunt to them. When they see me, they wag their head.

26.verse: Help me, ADONAI my God, Save me through Your lovingkindness.

27.verse: Let them know that it is Your hand— that You, ADONAI, have done it.

28.verse: They may curse, but You bless. When they arise, they will be ashamed, but Your servant will rejoice.

29.verse: My accusers will be clothed in disgrace, and wrapped in shame as in a cloak.

30.verse: I will greatly thank ADONAI with my mouth, and in the midst of a throng will I praise Him.

31.verse: For He stands at the right hand of the needy, to save him from those who condemn his soul.

1.verse: My Lord is a Kohen Forever Psalm 110 - A psalm of David. ADONAI declares to my Lord: “Sit at My right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”

2.verse: ADONAI will extend your mighty rod from Zion: “Rule in the midst of your enemies.”

3.verse: Your people will be a freewill offering in a day of your power. In holy splendors, from dawn’s womb, yours is the dew of your youth.

4.verse: ADONAI has sworn, and will not His mind: “You are a Kohen forever according to the order of Melchizedek.”

5.verse: My Lord is at your right hand. He will shatter kings in the day of His wrath.

6.verse: He will judge among the nations, heaping up corpses. He will crush heads over the entire land.

7.verse: He will drink from a stream along the way —so His head will be exalted.

1.verse: The Beginning of Wisdom Psalm 111 - Halleluyah! I praise ADONAI with all my heart in the company and congregation of the upright.

2.verse: Great are the works of ADONAI— searched out by all who delight in them.

3.verse: Glorious and majestic is His work, and His righteousness endures forever.

4.verse: He made His wonders memorable. ADONAI is gracious and full of compassion.

5.verse: He gives food to those who fear Him. He remembers His covenant forever.

6.verse: He shows His people His powerful deeds, giving them the heritage of the nations.

7.verse: The works of His hands are truth and justice. All His precepts are trustworthy—

8.verse: they are upheld forever and ever, made in truth and uprightness.

9.verse: He has sent redemption to His people. He has ordained His covenant forever. Holy and awesome is His Name.

10.verse: The fear of ADONAI is the beginning of wisdom. All who follow His precepts have good understanding. His praise endures forever!

1.verse: Blessed is the Righteous Man Psalm 112 - Halleluyah! Happy is the man who fears ADONAI, who delights greatly in His mitzvot.

2.verse: His offspring will be mighty in the land. The generation of the upright will be blessed.

3.verse: Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.

4.verse: Light shines in the darkness for the upright. Gracious, compassionate and just is he.

5.verse: Good comes to a man who is gracious and lends. He will order his affairs with fairness.

6.verse: Surely he will never be shaken. The righteous are remembered forever.

7.verse: He is not afraid of bad news— his heart is steadfast, trusting in ADONAI.

8.verse: His heart is secure, he will not fear— until he gazes on his foes.

9.verse: He gives freely to the poor. His righteousness endures forever. His horn is lifted high in honor.

10.verse: The wicked will see it and be indignant. He will gnash with his teeth and waste away. The desire of the wicked will perish.

1.verse: From the Rising of the Sun Psalm 113 - Halleluyah! Praise, O servants of ADONAI, praise the Name of ADONAI.

2.verse: Blessed be the Name of ADONAI from now and forever.

3.verse: From the rising of the sun to its going down the Name of ADONAI is to be praised.

4.verse: ADONAI is high above all nations, His glory is above the heavens.

5.verse: Who is like ADONAI our God, enthroned on high,

6.verse: who brings Himself down to look upon heaven and upon earth?

7.verse: He raises the poor from the dust, lifts up the needy out of the dunghill,

8.verse: to seat him with princes, with the princes of His people.

9.verse: He settles the barren woman in her home as a joyful mother of children. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Passover Song Psalm 114 - When Israel came out of Egypt, Jacob’s house from a people foreign-speaking,

2.verse: Judah became His Sanctuary, Israel His dominion.

3.verse: The sea saw and fled, the Jordan turned back.

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.

5.verse: Why was it, O sea, that you fled? O Jordan, that you turned back?

6.verse: O mountains, that you skipped like rams? O hills, like lambs?

7.verse: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,

8.verse: who turned the rock into a pool of water, the flint into a spring of water.

1.verse: Bless the Maker of Heaven and Earth Psalm 115 - Not to us, ADONAI, not to us, but to Your Name be the glory— because of Your love and Your faithfulness.

2.verse: Why should the nations say: “Where is their God now?”

3.verse: Our God is in the heavens— He does whatever pleases Him!

4.verse: Their idols are silver and gold, the work of human hands.

5.verse: They have mouths, but cannot speak; eyes, but cannot see.

6.verse: They have ears, but cannot hear; noses, but cannot smell.

7.verse: They have hands, but cannot feel; feet, but cannot walk, nor utter a sound with their throat.

8.verse: Those making them will become like them —everyone trusting in them.

9.verse: O Israel, trust in ADONAI— He is their help and their shield!

10.verse: O house of Aaron, trust in ADONAI— He is their help and their shield!

11.verse: O you who fear ADONAI, trust in ADONAI— He is their help and their shield!

12.verse: ADONAI has been mindful of us, He will bless: He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron;

13.verse: He will bless those who fear ADONAI, the small together with the great.

14.verse: May ADONAI increase you more and more —you and your children.

15.verse: May you be blessed by ADONAI, Maker of heaven and earth.

16.verse: The heavens are the heavens of ADONAI, but the earth He gave to the children of men.

17.verse: The dead do not praise ADONAI, nor do any who go down into silence.

18.verse: But we—we will bless ADONAI both now and forever. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Lift Up the Cup of Salvation Psalm 116 - I love ADONAI, for He hears my voice, my cries.

2.verse: Because He has turned His ear to me, I will call on Him all my days.

3.verse: The ropes of death entangled me, and the torments of Sheol found me. I found trouble and sorrow.

4.verse: Then I called upon the Name of ADONAI: “ADONAI, save my soul!”

5.verse: ADONAI is gracious and righteous— yes, our God is compassionate.

6.verse: ADONAI protects the simple-hearted. When I was brought low, He saved me.

7.verse: Return to your rest, my soul, for ADONAI has been good to you.

8.verse: For You delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.

9.verse: I will walk before ADONAI in the lands of the living.

10.verse: I trusted even when I said, “I am very afflicted”—

11.verse: even when I said in my haste, “All men are liars.”

12.verse: How can I repay ADONAI for all His bounties to me?

13.verse: I will lift up the cup of salvation, and call on the Name of ADONAI.

14.verse: I will fulfill my vows to ADONAI in the presence of all His people.

15.verse: Precious in the sight of ADONAI is the death of His kedoshim.

16.verse: O ADONAI! Surely I am Your servant. I am Your servant, the son of Your maidservant. You have freed me from my bonds.

17.verse: To You I will offer a sacrifice of praise, and will call on the Name of ADONAI.

18.verse: I will fulfill my vows to ADONAI in the presence of all His people,

19.verse: in the courts of the House of ADONAI, in your midst, O Jerusalem. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Praise Him, All You Nations Psalm 117 - Praise ADONAI, all you nations! Glorify Him, all you peoples.

2.verse: For great is His lovingkindness toward us, and ADONAI’s truth endures forever. Halleluyah!

1.verse: His Chesed Endures Forever Psalm 118 - Praise ADONAI, for He is good. For His lovingkindness endures forever.

2.verse: O let Israel say: For His lovingkindness endures forever.

3.verse: O let the house of Aaron say: For His lovingkindness endures forever.

4.verse: O let those who fear ADONAI say: For His lovingkindness endures forever.

5.verse: Out of a tight place I called on ADONAI— ADONAI answered me with a spacious place.

6.verse: ADONAI is for me—I will not fear! What can man do to me?

7.verse: ADONAI is for me, as my helper. I will see the downfall of those who hate me.

8.verse: It is better to take refuge in ADONAI than to trust in man.

9.verse: It is better to take refuge in ADONAI than to trust in princes.

10.verse: All nations surrounded me— in the Name of ADONAI I cut them off.

11.verse: They surrounded me, yes, all around me— in the Name of ADONAI I cut them off.

12.verse: They swarmed around me like bees— they were extinguished like burning thorns— in the Name of ADONAI I cut them off.

13.verse: You pushed me hard to make me fall, but ADONAI helped me.

14.verse: ADONAI is my strength and song, and He has become my salvation.

15.verse: Shouts of joy and victory are in the tents of the righteous: “ADONAI’s right hand is mighty!

16.verse: ADONAI’s right hand is lifted high! ADONAI’s right hand is mighty!”

17.verse: I will not die, but live, and proclaim what ADONAI has done!

18.verse: ADONAI has chastened me hard, but has not given me over to death.

19.verse: Open to me the gates of righteousness, that I may enter through them and praise ADONAI.

20.verse: This is the gate of ADONAI— the righteous will enter through it.

21.verse: I give You thanks, because You have answered me and have become my salvation.

22.verse: The stone the builders rejected has become the capstone.

23.verse: It is from ADONAI: it is marvelous in our eyes!

24.verse: This is the day that ADONAI has made! Let us rejoice and be glad in it!

25.verse: Hoshia-na! Please, ADONAI, save now! We beseech You, ADONAI, prosper us!

26.verse: Baruch haba b’Shem ADONAI— Blessed is He who comes in the Name of ADONAI. We bless you from the House of ADONAI.

27.verse: ADONAI is God, and He has given us light. Join the festival with branches, up to the horns of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I praise You. You are my God—I exalt You!

29.verse: Praise ADONAI, for He is good, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

1.verse: Learn Torah Letter by Letter Psalm 119 - ALEPH א Blessed are those whose way is blameless, who walk in the Torah of ADONAI.

2.verse: Happy are those who keep His testimonies, who seek Him with a whole heart,

3.verse: who also do no injustice, but walk in His ways.

4.verse: You have commanded that Your precepts be kept diligently.

5.verse: Oh that my ways were steadfast to observe Your decrees!

6.verse: Then I would not be ashamed, when I consider all Your mitzvot.

7.verse: I will praise You with an upright heart as I learn Your righteous judgments.

8.verse: I will observe Your statutes. Never abandon me utterly!

9.verse: BET ב How can a young man keep his way pure? By guarding it according to Your word.

10.verse: With my whole heart have I sought You —let me not stray from Your mitzvot.

11.verse: I have treasured Your word in my heart, so I might not sin against You.

12.verse: Blessed are You, ADONAI. Teach me Your statutes.

13.verse: With my lips I rehearse all the rulings of Your mouth.

14.verse: I rejoice in the way of Your testimonies above all wealth.

15.verse: I will meditate on Your precepts, and regard Your ways.

16.verse: I will delight in Your decrees. I will never forget Your word.

17.verse: GIMEL ג Do good to Your servant that I may live and keep Your word.

18.verse: Open my eyes, so I may behold wonders from Your Torah.

19.verse: I am a temporary dweller on earth— do not hide Your mitzvot from me.

20.verse: My soul is crushed with longing for Your judgments at all times.

21.verse: You rebuke the proud, who are cursed, who wander from Your mitzvot.

22.verse: Take scorn and contempt away from me, for I have kept Your testimonies.

23.verse: Though princes sit and talk against me, Your servant meditates on Your decrees.

24.verse: For Your testimonies are my delight— they are also my counselors.

25.verse: DALET ד My soul clings to the dust. Revive me according to Your word!

26.verse: I told of my ways and You answered me. Teach me Your statutes.

27.verse: Help me discern the way of Your precepts, so I may meditate on Your wonders.

28.verse: My soul weeps with grief. Make me stand firm with Your word.

29.verse: Turn me away from the deceitful way, and be gracious to me with Your Torah.

30.verse: I have chosen the way of faithfulness. I have set my heart on Your judgments.

31.verse: I cling to Your testimonies. ADONAI, do not put me to shame!

32.verse: I run the course of Your mitzvot, for You open wide my heart.

33.verse: HEY ה Teach me the way of Your decrees, ADONAI, and I will follow them to the end.

34.verse: Give me understanding, that I may keep Your Torah and observe it with all my heart.

35.verse: Help me walk in the path of Your mitzvot— for I delight in it.

36.verse: Turn my heart to Your testimonies and not to dishonest gain.

37.verse: Turn my eyes away from gazing at vanity but revive me in Your ways.

38.verse: Fulfill Your word to Your servant, which leads to reverence for You.

39.verse: Make the disgrace I dread pass away, for Your judgments are good.

40.verse: Behold, I long for Your precepts. Revive me by Your righteousness.

41.verse: VAV ו May Your lovingkindnesses come to me, ADONAI— Your salvation according to Your word—

42.verse: so I may answer the one taunting me, for I trust in Your word.

43.verse: Never snatch out of my mouth a word of truth, for I hope in Your judgments.

44.verse: So I may always keep Your Torah, forever and ever,

45.verse: and walk about in freedom. For I have sought Your precepts.

46.verse: I will speak of Your testimonies before kings, and never be ashamed.

47.verse: I delight in Your mitzvot, which I love.

48.verse: I reach out my hands for Your mitzvot, which I love, and meditate on Your decrees.

49.verse: ZAYIN ז Remember the word to Your servant, on which You have made me hope.

50.verse: My comfort in my affliction is this: Your word has kept me alive.

51.verse: The arrogant have viciously ridiculed me, yet I did not turn away from Your Torah.

52.verse: I remember Your judgments from of old, ADONAI, and comfort myself.

53.verse: Burning indignation grips me, because of the wicked who forsake Your Torah.

54.verse: Your decrees have become my songs in the house where I dwell.

55.verse: In the night I remember Your Name, ADONAI, and keep watching over Your Torah.

56.verse: This is my own: that I keep Your precepts.

57.verse: CHET ח ADONAI is my portion. I promised to guard Your words.

58.verse: I have entreated Your favor with all my heart. Be gracious to me according to Your word.

59.verse: I have considered my ways and turned my feet back to Your testimonies.

60.verse: I hasten and do not delay to obey Your mitzvot.

61.verse: The ropes of the wicked are coiled around me, but I did not forget Your Torah.

62.verse: At midnight I rise to praise You, because of Your righteous rulings.

63.verse: I am a companion of all who fear You, of those who observe Your precepts.

64.verse: The earth is full of Your lovingkindness. ADONAI—teach me Your decrees.

65.verse: TET ט You do good to Your servant, ADONAI, according to Your word.

66.verse: Teach me good sense and knowledge, for I trusted in Your mitzvot.

67.verse: Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I keep Your word.

68.verse: You are good and keep doing good— teach me Your decrees.

69.verse: Though the proud smeared a lie on me, with all my heart I keep Your precepts.

70.verse: Their minds are insensible, but Your Torah is my delight.

71.verse: It is good for me that I was afflicted, so that I may learn Your decrees.

72.verse: The Torah from Your mouth is better to me than thousands of gold and silver pieces.

73.verse: YOD י Your hands have made me and formed me. Give me understanding that I may learn Your mitzvot.

74.verse: Those in awe of You see me and rejoice, because I put my hope in Your word.

75.verse: I know, ADONAI, Your judgments are just. In faithfulness You have afflicted me.

76.verse: May Your lovingkindness comfort me, according to Your promise to Your servant.

77.verse: Let Your tender mercies reach me, Let me live, for Your Torah is my delight.

78.verse: May the proud be put to shame for wronging me with a lie, but I will meditate on Your precepts.

79.verse: Let those in awe of You return to me— those who know Your testimonies.

80.verse: My heart will have integrity in following Your decrees, so that I would not be ashamed.

81.verse: KAF כ My soul faints with longing for Your salvation, but I still hope in Your word.

82.verse: My eyes are worn out longing for Your promise, saying, “When will You comfort me?”

83.verse: Though I became like a wineskin dried in smoke, I do not forget Your decrees.

84.verse: How many are the days of Your servant? When will You execute judgment on my persecutors?

85.verse: The proud have dug pits for me— that is not in accord with Your Torah!

86.verse: All Your mitzvot are faithful. They persecute me with a lie—help me!

87.verse: They almost finished me off on earth. But I—I will not forsake Your precepts.

88.verse: Revive me with Your lovingkindness, so I may keep Your mouth’s testimony.

89.verse: LAMED ל Forever, ADONAI, Your word stands firm in the heavens.

90.verse: Your faithfulness endures from generation to generation. You established the earth, and it stands.

91.verse: Your judgments stand today, for all things are Your servants.

92.verse: If Your Torah had not been my delight, I would have perished in my affliction.

93.verse: I will never forget Your precepts. For with them You have kept me alive.

94.verse: I am Yours, save me! For I have sought out Your precepts.

95.verse: The wicked wait for me to destroy me. But I will study Your testimonies.

96.verse: I have seen a limit to all perfection, yet Your commandment is boundless.

97.verse: MEM מ O how I love Your Torah! It is my meditation all day.

98.verse: Your mitzvot make me wiser than my enemies —for they are mine forever.

99.verse: I have more insight than all my teachers, for Your testimonies are my meditation.

100.verse: I have gained more understanding than all my elders, for I have kept Your precepts.

101.verse: I kept my feet from every evil way, in order to follow Your word.

102.verse: I do not turn away from Your rulings, for You Yourself have taught me.

103.verse: How sweet is Your word to my taste— yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

104.verse: From Your precepts I get discernment, therefore I hate every false way.

105.verse: NUN נ Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.

106.verse: I have sworn and confirmed to observe Your righteous rulings.

107.verse: I am severely afflicted. Keep me alive, ADONAI, according to Your word.

108.verse: Please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, ADONAI, and teach me Your rulings.

109.verse: My soul is continually in danger, yet I have not forgotten Your Torah.

110.verse: The wicked have set a snare for me, yet I did not stray from Your precepts.

111.verse: Your testimonies I have as a heritage forever, for they are my heart’s joy.

112.verse: I turned my heart to do Your decrees, forever, to the very end.

113.verse: SAMECH ס I hate double-minded ones, but Your Torah I love.

114.verse: You are my hiding place and my shield —in Your word I hope.

115.verse: Away from me, evildoers, so I may keep the mitzvot of my God!

116.verse: Sustain me according to Your word, so I may live, and let me not be ashamed of my hope.

117.verse: Support me and I will be saved, and study Your decrees continually.

118.verse: You despise all who wander from Your decrees, for their deceitfulness is in vain.

119.verse: All the wicked of the earth You remove like dross. Therefore I love Your testimonies.

120.verse: My flesh shudders for fear of You, and I am in awe of Your judgments.

121.verse: AYIN ע I did what is just and right. Do not leave me to my oppressors.

122.verse: Guarantee Your servant’s well-being. Do not let arrogant ones oppress me.

123.verse: My eyes fail, longing for Your salvation and for Your righteous word.

124.verse: Deal with Your servant as befits Your lovingkindness, and teach me Your statutes.

125.verse: I am Your servant, give me discernment, so I may understand Your testimonies.

126.verse: It is time for ADONAI to act— they have violated Your Torah!

127.verse: Therefore I love Your mitzvot more than gold, more than pure gold.

128.verse: Therefore I esteem all Your precepts as right in every way —every false way I hate.

129.verse: PE פ Your testimonies are wonderful. Therefore my soul obeys them.

130.verse: The unfolding of Your words gives light, giving understanding to the simple.

131.verse: I opened my mouth wide and panted, for I longed for Your mitzvot.

132.verse: Turn to me and be gracious to me, as is fitting to those who love Your Name.

133.verse: Direct my footsteps in Your word, and let no iniquity get mastery over me.

134.verse: Redeem me from human oppression, and I will keep Your precepts.

135.verse: Make Your face shine on Your servant, and teach me Your decrees.

136.verse: Streams of water run down from my eyes, because they do not observe Your Torah.

137.verse: TZADHE צ Righteous are You, ADONAI, and Your judgments are upright.

138.verse: You have commanded righteousness, Your testimonies, and great faithfulness.

139.verse: My zeal has consumed me, because my foes forgot Your words.

140.verse: Your word is thoroughly refined, and Your servant loves it.

141.verse: I am insignificant and despised, yet I have not forgotten Your precepts.

142.verse: Your justice is righteousness forever, and Your Torah is truth.

143.verse: Trouble and anguish have overtaken me, yet Your mitzvot are my delight.

144.verse: Your testimonies are righteous forever —make me understand, so I may live.

145.verse: KOF ק I cried out with all my heart, “Answer me, ADONAI! I will keep Your decrees.”

146.verse: I cried out to You, “Save me, and I will keep Your testimonies.”

147.verse: I am up before dawn, crying for help— I put my hope in Your word.

148.verse: My eyes are up before every night watch, as I meditate on Your word.

149.verse: Hear my voice with Your lovingkindness. Revive me, ADONAI, with Your judgments.

150.verse: Pursuers of wicked schemes draw near— they are far from Your Torah.

151.verse: You are near, ADONAI, and all Your mitzvot are truth.

152.verse: Long ago I learned from Your testimonies that You founded them firmly forever.

153.verse: RESH ר See my affliction and rescue me, for I do not forget Your Torah.

154.verse: Defend my cause and redeem me. Restore my life through Your word.

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wicked, for they do not seek after Your decrees.

156.verse: Great are Your mercies, ADONAI. Restore my life with Your judgments.

157.verse: Many are my persecutors and my foes. Yet I do not turn from Your testimonies.

158.verse: I see the treacherous and loathe them, because they do not keep Your word.

159.verse: See how I loved Your precepts. Restore my life, ADONAI, with Your lovingkindness.

160.verse: Truth is the essence of Your word, and all Your righteous rulings are eternal.

161.verse: SHIN ש Princes persecute me for no reason, but my heart is in awe of Your words.

162.verse: I rejoice in Your word, as one who finds great spoil.

163.verse: I hate and abhor falsehood, but Your Torah I love.

164.verse: Seven times a day I praise You, because of Your righteous judgments.

165.verse: Great peace have they who love Your Torah, and nothing causes them to stumble.

166.verse: I hope for Your salvation, ADONAI, and do Your mitzvot.

167.verse: My soul has observed Your testimonies and I love them exceedingly.

168.verse: I observe Your precepts and Your laws, for all my ways are before You.

169.verse: TAV ת Let my cry come to You, ADONAI. Grant me understanding by Your word.

170.verse: Let my supplication come before You. Deliver me, according to Your promise.

171.verse: My lips utter praise, for You teach me Your statutes.

172.verse: My tongue sings of Your word, for all Your mitzvot are righteous.

173.verse: Let Your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen Your precepts.

174.verse: I long for Your deliverance, ADONAI, and Your Torah is my delight.

175.verse: Let my soul live and praise You, and may Your rulings help me.

176.verse: I have strayed like a lost sheep—seek Your servant. For I did not forget Your mitzvot.

1.verse: I Am for Shalom Psalm 120 - A Song of Ascents. In my trouble I cried out to ADONAI, and He answered me.

2.verse: ADONAI, deliver my soul from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue.

3.verse: What can be given to you, and what more can be done to you, O deceitful tongue?—

4.verse: sharp arrows of the mighty, with burning coals of a broom tree!

5.verse: Woe to me, for I sojourn in Meshech, for I dwell among the tents of Kedar!

6.verse: My soul has too long dwelt with those who hate shalom.

7.verse: I am for shalom and thus I speak, but they are for war!

1.verse: He Watches Over You Psalm 121 - A Song of Ascents. I will lift up my eyes to the mountains— from where does my help come?

2.verse: My help comes from ADONAI, Maker of heaven and earth.

3.verse: He will not let your foot slip. Your Keeper will not slumber.

4.verse: Behold, the Keeper of Israel neither slumbers nor sleeps.

5.verse: ADONAI is your Keeper. ADONAI is your shadow at your right hand.

6.verse: The sun will not strike you by day, nor the moon by night.

7.verse: ADONAI will protect you from all evil. He will guard your life.

8.verse: ADONAI will watch over your coming and your going from this time forth and forevermore.

1.verse: Pray for the Peace of Jerusalem Psalm 122 - A Song of Ascents. Of David. I rejoiced when they said to me, “Let us go to the House of ADONAI.”

2.verse: Our feet are standing in your gates, Jerusalem—

3.verse: Jerusalem, built as a city joined together.

4.verse: There the tribes go up, the tribes of ADONAI —as a testimony to Israel— to praise the Name of ADONAI.

5.verse: For there thrones for judgment are set up, the thrones of the house of David.

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem— “May those who love you be at peace!

7.verse: May there be shalom within your walls— quietness within your palaces.”

8.verse: For the sake of my brothers and friends, I now say: “Shalom be within you.”

9.verse: For the sake of the House of ADONAI our God, I will seek your good.

1.verse: Be Gracious to Your Servants Psalm 123 - A Song of Ascents. To You I lift up my eyes— You enthroned in the heavens.

2.verse: Behold, as the eyes of slaves to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a slave-girl to the hand of her mistress— so our eyes look to ADONAI our God, till He shows us favor.

3.verse: Show us favor, ADONAI, show us favor! For we have endured much contempt.

4.verse: Our soul has had enough of the scorn of those at ease, the contempt of the proud.

1.verse: Had He Not Been on Our Side Psalm 124 - A Song of Ascents. Of David. “Had ADONAI not been on our side” —let Israel now say—

2.verse: “Had ADONAI not been on our side, when men rose up against us,

3.verse: then they would have swallowed us alive, when their wrath burned against us.

4.verse: Then the waters would have engulfed us, the torrent would have swept over our soul,

5.verse: then the raging waters would have swept over our soul.”

6.verse: Blessed be ADONAI, who has not given us as prey for their teeth.

7.verse: Our soul has escaped like a bird out of the snare of the trappers— the snare is broken, and we escaped!

8.verse: Our help is in the Name of ADONAI, Maker of heaven and earth.

1.verse: Like the Mountains Around Jerusalem Psalm 125 - A Song of Ascents. Those who trust in ADONAI are like Mount Zion— it cannot be moved, but endures forever.

2.verse: As the mountains are around Jerusalem, so ADONAI is all around His people, both now and forever.

3.verse: For a scepter of wickedness will not rest over the land of the righteous— lest the righteous set their hands to evil.

4.verse: Do good, ADONAI, to the good, and to those upright in their hearts.

5.verse: But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways, ADONAI will lead them away with evildoers. Shalom be upon Israel.

1.verse: Joyful Restoration of Zion Psalm 126 - A Song of Ascents. When ADONAI restored the captives of Zion, it was as if we were dreaming.

2.verse: Then our mouth was filled with laughter, and our tongue with a song of joy. Then they said among the nations, “ADONAI has done great things for them.”

3.verse: ADONAI has done great things for us —we are joyful!

4.verse: Restore us from captivity, ADONAI, like streams in the Negev.

5.verse: Those who sow in tears will reap with a song of joy.

6.verse: Whoever keeps going out weeping, carrying his bag of seed, will surely come back with a song of joy, carrying his sheaves.

1.verse: He Gives Sleep to His Children Psalm 127 - A Song of Ascents. Of Solomon. Unless ADONAI builds the house, the builders labor in vain. Unless ADONAI watches over the city, the watchman stands guard in vain.

2.verse: In vain you rise up early and stay up late, eating the bread of toil— for He provides for His beloved ones even in their sleep.

3.verse: Behold, children are a heritage of ADONAI —the fruit of the womb is a reward.

4.verse: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man, so are the children of one’s youth.

5.verse: Happy is the man whose quiver is full of them. They will not be put to shame when they speak with their enemies at the gate.

1.verse: Blessing on Those Who Fear God Psalm 128 - A Song of Ascents. Happy is everyone in awe of ADONAI, who walks in His ways,

2.verse: for you will eat the labor of your hands. You will be blessed and it will be good for you.

3.verse: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine within your house. Your children will be like olive saplings around your table.

4.verse: Behold, thus will the man be blessed who fears ADONAI.

5.verse: May ADONAI bless you out of Zion, and may you see Jerusalem in prosperity all the days of your life,

6.verse: and may you live to see your children’s children. Shalom be upon Israel!

1.verse: Haters Won’t Prevail Psalm 129 - A Song of Ascents. “How many times they have been hostile to me, even from my youth”—let Israel now say—

2.verse: “How greatly they have been hostile to me, even from my youth. Yet they have not prevailed against me.

3.verse: Plowmen plowed on my back— they made their furrows long!”

4.verse: ADONAI is righteous— He has cut the ropes of the wicked.

5.verse: May all who hate Zion be driven back in disgrace.

6.verse: Let them be like grass on the roofs, which withers before it springs up—

7.verse: with it a reaper cannot fill his hand, nor can a binder of sheaves fill his lap.

8.verse: So the passersby may never say: “The blessing of ADONAI be upon you— we bless you in the Name of ADONAI.”

1.verse: Forgiveness and Full Redemption Psalm 130 - A Song of Ascents. Out of the depths I cry to You, ADONAI!

2.verse: Lord, hear my voice! Let Your ears be attentive to the sound of my supplications.

3.verse: If You, ADONAI, kept a record of iniquities— my Lord, who could stand?

4.verse: For with You there is forgiveness, so You may be revered.

5.verse: I wait for ADONAI, my soul waits, and in His word I hope.

6.verse: My soul waits for my Lord, more than watchmen for the morning, watchmen for the morning.

7.verse: O Israel, wait for ADONAI. For with ADONAI there is lovingkindness, and with Him is full redemption,

8.verse: and He will redeem Israel from all its iniquities.

1.verse: Be Still My Soul Psalm 131 - A Song of Ascents. Of David. ADONAI, my heart is not proud, nor my eyes lofty, nor do I go after things too great or too difficult for me.

2.verse: But I have calmed and quieted my soul— like a weaned child with his mother, like a weaned child is my soul within me.

3.verse: O Israel, put your hope in ADONAI from this time forth and forever.

1.verse: Promise of Ben-David Psalm 132 - A Song of Ascents. ADONAI, remember David, all his afflictions,

2.verse: and how he swore to ADONAI, vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

3.verse: “I will not enter the tent of my house nor lie on my bed,

4.verse: nor will I will give sleep to my eyes, nor slumber to my eyelids,

5.verse: till I find a place for ADONAI, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

6.verse: Behold, we heard of it in Ephratha, we found it in the fields of Joar.

7.verse: Let us go into His dwelling place, let us bow at His footstool.

8.verse: Arise, ADONAI, to Your resting place— You, and the Ark of Your might.

9.verse: Let Your kohanim wear righteousness, and let Your godly ones sing for joy.

10.verse: For Your servant David’s sake do not turn away the face of Your anointed.

11.verse: ADONAI has sworn to David a true promise He will not revoke: “From the fruit of your body I will set one upon your throne—

12.verse: if your children keep My covenant and My law that I will teach them, then their sons will sit on your throne forever.”

13.verse: For ADONAI has chosen Zion, He has desired it for His dwelling:

14.verse: “This is My resting place forever. Here I dwell, for I have desired it.

15.verse: I will abundantly bless her food. I will satisfy her needy ones with bread.

16.verse: I will clothe her kohanim with salvation, and her godly ones will sing aloud for joy.

17.verse: There will I make a horn spring up for David, I have set up a lamp for My anointed.

18.verse: His enemies I will clothe with shame, but upon himself his crown will shine.”

1.verse: Blessing of Unity Psalm 133 - A Song of Ascents. Of David. Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to dwell together in unity!

2.verse: It is like the precious oil upon the head, coming down upon the beard—Aaron’s beard— coming down on the collar of his robes.

3.verse: It is like the dew of Hermon, coming down upon the mountains of Zion. For there ADONAI commanded the blessing —life forevermore!

1.verse: Call to Evening Worship Psalm 134 - A Song of Ascents. Behold, bless ADONAI, all servants of ADONAI, who stand by night in the House of ADONAI.

2.verse: Lift up your hands to the Sanctuary and bless ADONAI.

3.verse: May ADONAI bless you out of Zion— Maker of heaven and earth.

1.verse: Jacob as His Treasure Psalm 135 - Halleluyah! Praise the Name of ADONAI. Give praise, O servants of ADONAI—

2.verse: standing in the House of ADONAI, in the courts of the House of our God.

3.verse: Praise ADONAI, for ADONAI is good. Sing praises to His Name, for it is delightful.

4.verse: For ADONAI has chosen Jacob for Himself, Israel as His treasured possession.

5.verse: For I have known that ADONAI is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

6.verse: Whatever ADONAI pleases, He does, in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps.

7.verse: He makes clouds rise from the ends of the earth. He makes lightning for the rain. He brings wind out of His storehouses.

8.verse: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, both man and beast.

9.verse: He sent signs and wonders among you, O Egypt, on Pharaoh and all his servants.

10.verse: He struck down many nations and slew mighty kings:

11.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites, and Og, king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan,

12.verse: and gave their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to His people Israel.

13.verse: ADONAI, Your Name endures forever, Your renown, ADONAI, from generation to generation.

14.verse: For ADONAI will vindicate His people, and have compassion on His servants.

15.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of human hands.

16.verse: They have mouths, but cannot speak, eyes, but cannot see;

17.verse: they have ears, but cannot hear, nor is there any breath in their mouths.

18.verse: Those who make them will be like them— so will all who keep trusting in them.

19.verse: O house of Israel, bless ADONAI! O house of Aaron, bless ADONAI!

20.verse: O house of Levi, bless ADONAI! You who revere ADONAI, bless ADONAI!

21.verse: Blessed be ADONAI out of Zion, who dwells in Jerusalem. Halleluyah!

1.verse: His Chesed Endures Forever! Psalm 136 - Praise ADONAI, for He is good, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

2.verse: Praise the God of gods, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

3.verse: Praise the Lord of lords, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

4.verse: who alone did great wonders, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

5.verse: who made the heavens by wisdom, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

6.verse: who spread the earth on the waters, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

7.verse: who made great lights, for His lovingkindness endures forever—

8.verse: the sun to rule by day, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

9.verse: the moon and stars to rule by night, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

10.verse: who struck Egypt in their firstborn, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

11.verse: and led out Israel from among them, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

12.verse: with a strong hand and outstretched arm, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

13.verse: who cut the Sea of Reeds into parts, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

14.verse: and made Israel pass through the midst of it, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

15.verse: but hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Sea of Reeds, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

16.verse: who led His people through the desert, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

17.verse: who struck down great kings, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

18.verse: and slew mighty kings, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

19.verse: Sihon, king of the Amorites, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

20.verse: and Og, king of Bashan, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

21.verse: and gave their land for an inheritance, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

22.verse: an inheritance for Israel His servant, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

23.verse: He remembered us in our lowly estate, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

24.verse: and separated between us and He delivered us from our adversaries, for His lovingkindness endures forever,

25.verse: who gives food to all flesh, for His lovingkindness endures forever.

26.verse: Praise the God of heaven, for His lovingkindness endures forever!

1.verse: By the Rivers of Babylon Psalm 137 - By the rivers of Babylon, we sat down and wept, when we remembered Zion.

2.verse: On the willows there we hung up our harps.

3.verse: For there our captors demanded songs and our tormentors asked for joy: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”

4.verse: How can we sing a song of ADONAI in a foreign land?

5.verse: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand wither.

6.verse: May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth if I cease to remember you, if I do not set Jerusalem above my chief joy.

7.verse: Remember, ADONAI, the children of Edom, what they said on the day Jerusalem fell: “Strip her, strip her to her very foundation!”

8.verse: O daughter of Babylon, the devastated one, happy is the one who repays you as you have paid us.

9.verse: Happy is the one who seizes your little ones and dashes them upon the rock.

1.verse: Your Right Hand Delivers Me Psalm 138 - Of David. I praise You with all my heart. In the presence of the mighty I will sing praises to You.

2.verse: I bow down toward Your holy Temple and praise Your Name for Your love and Your faithfulness. For You—magnified above all Your Name and Your word.

3.verse: On the day I called, You answered me. You made me bold with strength in my soul.

4.verse: All the kings of the earth will praise You, ADONAI, when they hear Your mouth’s speech.

5.verse: So they will sing of the ways of ADONAI, for great is the glory of ADONAI.

6.verse: For though ADONAI is exalted, yet He looks upon the lowly, but the haughty He knows from afar.

7.verse: Though I walk amid trouble, You revive me. You stretch out Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, and Your right hand delivers me.

8.verse: ADONAI will fulfill His purpose for me. Your lovingkindness, ADONAI, endures forever. Do not abandon the work of Your hands.

1.verse: How Precious Your Thoughts! Psalm 139 - For the music director: a psalm of David. ADONAI, You searched me and know me.

2.verse: Whenever I sit down or stand up, You know it. You discern my thinking from afar.

3.verse: You observe my journeying and my resting and You are familiar with all my ways.

4.verse: Even before a word is on my tongue, behold, ADONAI, You know all about it.

5.verse: You hemmed me in behind and before, and laid Your hand upon me.

6.verse: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, too lofty for me to attain.

7.verse: Where can I go from Your Ruach? Where can I flee from Your presence?

8.verse: If I go up to heaven, You are there, and if I make my bed in Sheol, look, You are there too.

9.verse: If I take the wings of the dawn and settle on the other side of the sea,

10.verse: even there Your hand will lead me, and Your right hand will lay hold of me.

11.verse: If I say: “Surely darkness covers me, night keeps light at a distance from me,”

12.verse: even darkness is not dark for You, and night is as bright as day— darkness and light are alike.

13.verse: For You have created my conscience. You knit me together in my mother’s womb.

14.verse: I praise You, for I am awesomely, wonderfully made! Wonderful are Your works— and my soul knows that very well.

15.verse: My frame was not hidden from You when I was made in the secret place, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth.

16.verse: Your eyes saw me when I was unformed, and in Your book were written the days that were formed— when not one of them had come to be.

17.verse: How precious are Your thoughts, O God! How great is the sum of them!

18.verse: Were I to count them, they would outnumber the grains of sand! When I awake, I am still with You.

19.verse: If only You would slay the wicked, O God! Away from me, you bloody men!

20.verse: For they speak about You with wicked intent. Your enemies reproach You in vain.

21.verse: Do I not hate those who hate You, ADONAI? Do I not loathe those who rise against You?

22.verse: I hate them with total hatred— I consider them my enemies.

23.verse: Search me, O God, and know my heart. Examine me, and know my anxious thoughts,

24.verse: and see if there be any offensive way within me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

1.verse: Protection from the Wicked Psalm 140 - For the music director: a psalm of David.

2.verse: Rescue me, ADONAI, from the evil man. Protect me from the violent men—

3.verse: who devise evil in their heart— every day they stir up wars.

4.verse: They sharpen their tongue like a serpent’s —viper’s venom is under their lips. Selah

5.verse: Keep me safe, ADONAI, from the clutches of the wicked. Protect me from the man of violence who planned to push me off my feet.

6.verse: The proud have hidden a trap and cords for me. They spread out a net by the path. They set snares for me. Selah

7.verse: I said to ADONAI: “You are my God!” Hear, ADONAI, the sound of my supplications.

8.verse: God my Lord, the strength of my deliverance, You shield my head in the day of battle.

9.verse: Grant not, ADONAI, the desires of the wicked. Do not let their evil plan succeed, or they will exalt themselves. Selah

10.verse: As for the head of those surrounding me, may the mischief of their lips overwhelm them.

11.verse: Let burning coals fall upon them. May they be cast into the fire, into deep pits, never to rise again.

12.verse: May a slanderer not endure in the land. May calamity hunt down a violent man.

13.verse: I know ADONAI will vindicate the poor, and secure justice for the needy.

1.verse: Evening Petition for Protection Psalm 141 - A psalm of David. ADONAI, I call to You—come quickly to me! Hear my voice when I call to You.

2.verse: May my prayer be set before You like incense. May the lifting up of my hands be like the evening sacrifice.

3.verse: Set a guard, ADONAI, over my mouth. Keep watch over the door of my lips.

4.verse: Let not my heart turn to any evil thing, to practice deeds of wickedness with men that work iniquity, nor let me eat of their delicacies.

5.verse: Let the righteous strike me—it is kindness. Let him correct me—it is oil on my head —my head will not refuse it. Yet still my prayer is against their wickedness.

6.verse: Their judges are thrown down from a cliff. Then they will hear my words, since they are sweet.

7.verse: As when one plows and breaks open the earth, so our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

8.verse: For my eyes are toward You, God my Lord. In You I have taken refuge—do not expose my soul.

9.verse: Keep me from the jaws of the trap they have laid for me, and from the snares of the evildoers.

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by safely.

1.verse: A Refuge from Trouble Psalm 142 - A contemplative poem of David, when he was in the cave, a prayer.

2.verse: I cry aloud with my voice to ADONAI. With my voice I seek favor from ADONAI.

3.verse: I pour out my complaint before Him, before Him I tell my trouble.

4.verse: When my spirit grows faint within me, You know my path. In the way where I walk they have hidden a trap for me.

5.verse: Look at my right hand and see, for no one cares about me. I have no refuge— no one cares for my soul.

6.verse: I have cried out to You, ADONAI. I said: “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.”

7.verse: Listen to my cry, for I am brought very low. Rescue me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.

1.verse: Hide Not Your Face from Me Psalm 143 - A psalm of David. Hear my prayer, ADONAI, give ear to my petitions. In Your faithfulness and Your righteousness, answer me!

2.verse: Do not bring Your servant into judgment, for in Your eyes no one living is righteous.

3.verse: For an enemy pursues my soul. He crushes my life down to the ground. He makes me dwell in darkness, like those long dead.

4.verse: So my spirit grows faint within me. My heart is shocked within me.

5.verse: I remember the days of old. I meditate on all You have done. I ponder the work of Your hands.

6.verse: I spread forth my hands to You. My soul longs for You as a parched land. Selah

7.verse: Answer me speedily, ADONAI—my spirit fails. Hide not Your face from me, lest I become like those who go down into the Pit.

8.verse: Make me hear Your lovingkindness in the morning, for in You I trust. Show me the way I should go, for to You I lift up my soul.

9.verse: Deliver me from my enemies, ADONAI. I hide myself in You.

10.verse: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. Let Your good Ruach lead me on level ground.

11.verse: For Your Name’s sake, ADONAI, revive me. In Your justice bring my soul out of trouble.

12.verse: In Your mercy cut off my enemies and destroy all who harass my soul, for I am Your servant.

1.verse: Rescue from Battle Psalm 144 - Of David. Blessed be ADONAI my Rock— who trains my hands for war, my fingers for battle.

2.verse: He is my lovingkindness, my fortress, my strong tower, and my deliverer, my shield, in whom I take refuge, who subdues my people under me.

3.verse: ADONAI, what is man, that You take note of him? Or the son of man, that You consider him?

4.verse: Man is like a breath— his days are like a passing shadow.

5.verse: ADONAI, part Your heavens and come down. Touch the mountains, so they smoke.

6.verse: Flash forth lightning and scatter them. Send out Your arrows and confuse them.

7.verse: Stretch forth Your hands from on high. Snatch me, deliver me out of deep waters, out of the hand of foreigners,

8.verse: whose mouth speaks falsehood, whose right hand is a right hand of deceit.

9.verse: God, I sing a new song to You, on a ten-string harp I sing praises to You—

10.verse: who gives salvation to kings, who rescues Your servant David from the evil sword.

11.verse: Snatch me, deliver me out of the hand of foreigners, whose mouth speaks falsehood, whose right hand is a right hand of deceit.

12.verse: Then our sons will be like plants nurtured in their youth, our daughters like corner pillars carved for the construction of a palace.

13.verse: Our storehouses are full, supplying every kind of produce. Our flocks increase by thousands and ten thousands in our fields.

14.verse: Our oxen bear a heavy load. There is no breach, no going into captivity, no outcry in our streets.

15.verse: Happy are such a people! Blessed are the people whose God is ADONAI!

1.verse: Glory of the Kingdom Psalm 145 - A psalm of praise. Of David. I will exalt You, my God, the King, and I will bless Your Name forever and ever.

2.verse: Every day I will bless You, and praise Your Name forever and ever!

3.verse: Great is ADONAI, and greatly to be praised —His greatness is unsearchable.

4.verse: One generation will praise Your works to another and declare Your mighty acts.

5.verse: I will meditate on the glorious splendor of Your majesty and Your wonders.

6.verse: They will speak of the might of Your awesome deeds, and I will proclaim Your greatness.

7.verse: They will pour out the renown of Your great goodness, and sing joyfully of Your righteousness.

8.verse: ADONAI is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and great in lovingkindness.

9.verse: ADONAI is good to all. He has compassion on all His creatures.

10.verse: All Your works praise You, ADONAI, and Your kedoshim bless You.

11.verse: They declare the glory of Your kingdom and speak of Your might,

12.verse: to make known to the sons of men His mighty acts and the glory of the majesty of His kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom is a kingdom for all ages, and Your dominion endures from generation to generation.

14.verse: ADONAI upholds all who fall and raises up all who are bowed down.

15.verse: The eyes of all look to You and You give them their food on time.

16.verse: You open Your hand and satisfy every living thing with favor.

17.verse: ADONAI is righteous in all His ways and kind in all His deeds.

18.verse: ADONAI is near to all who call on Him, to all who call on Him in truth.

19.verse: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him. He will hear their cry and save them.

20.verse: ADONAI watches over all who love Him, but all the wicked He will destroy.

21.verse: My mouth declares the praise of ADONAI. Let all flesh bless His holy Name forever and ever!

1.verse: Justice of the Kingdom Psalm 146 - Halleluyah! Praise ADONAI, O my soul!

2.verse: I will praise ADONAI all my life. I will praise my God yet again.

3.verse: Do not put your trust in princes— in man, in whom there is no salvation.

4.verse: His breath departs, he returns to his dust. In that very day his plans perish.

5.verse: Happy is he whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in ADONAI his God,

6.verse: who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, who keeps truth forever,

7.verse: who executes justice for the oppressed, who gives bread to the hungry. ADONAI sets the prisoners free.

8.verse: ADONAI opens the eyes of the blind. ADONAI raises up those who are bowed down. ADONAI loves the righteous.

9.verse: ADONAI protects outsiders, upholds the fatherless and the widow, but thwarts the way of the wicked.

10.verse: ADONAI will reign forever, your God, O Zion, from generation to generation. Halleluyah!

1.verse: He Builds Up Jerusalem Psalm 147 - Halleluyah! How good it is to sing praises to our God. How pleasant and fitting is praise.

2.verse: ADONAI builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the exiles of Israel.

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

4.verse: He determines the number of the stars. He gives them all their names.

5.verse: Great is our Lord and mighty in power— His understanding is infinite!

6.verse: ADONAI upholds the humble. He brings the wicked to the ground.

7.verse: Sing to ADONAI with thanksgiving. Sing praises to our God on the harp.

8.verse: He covers the sky with clouds. He provides rain for the earth. He makes grass sprout on the hills.

9.verse: He gives food to the cattle and to the young ravens which cry.

10.verse: He delights not in the horse’s strength, nor takes pleasure in a man’s legs.

11.verse: ADONAI delights in those who revere Him, in those who trust in His lovingkindness.

12.verse: Exalt ADONAI, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!

13.verse: For He strengthens the bars of your gates. He blesses your children within you.

14.verse: He puts shalom within your borders. He satisfies you with the finest wheat.

15.verse: He sends earth His command— His word runs swiftly.

16.verse: He gives snow like wool. He scatters frost like ashes.

17.verse: He hurls down His hail like pebbles— who can stand before His cold?

18.verse: He sends forth His word and melts them. He makes His wind blow and waters flow.

19.verse: He declares His word to Jacob, His decrees and His rulings to Israel.

20.verse: He has not done so with any other nation. They have not known His judgments. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Praise Him, All Creation! Psalm 148 - Halleluyah! Praise ADONAI from the heavens! Praise Him in the highest!

2.verse: Praise Him all His angels! Praise Him all His armies.

3.verse: Praise Him, sun and moon!  Praise Him, all stars of light.

4.verse: Praise Him, highest heavens, and waters above the heavens.

5.verse: Let them praise the Name of ADONAI, for He commanded and they were created.

6.verse: He set them in place forever and ever. He made a decree that will never pass away.

7.verse: Praise ADONAI from the earth, sea monsters and all depths,

8.verse: fire and hail, snow and vapor, storm wind doing His bidding,

9.verse: mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,

10.verse: beasts and all cattle, crawling things and winged birds,

11.verse: kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all rulers of earth,

12.verse: both young men and maidens, old men and children.

13.verse: Let them praise the Name of ADONAI, for His Name alone is exalted. His glory is above earth and heaven.

14.verse: He has raised up a horn for His people, a praise for all His kedoshim, for the children of Israel— a people near to Him. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Praise with Singing and Dancing Psalm 149 - Halleluyah! Sing to ADONAI a new song, His praise in the assembly of the kedoshim.

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in its Maker. Let the children of Zion be glad in their King.

3.verse: Let them praise His Name with dancing. Let them sing praises to Him with tambourine and harp.

4.verse: For ADONAI takes pleasure in His people. He crowns the humble with salvation.

5.verse: Let the kedoshim exult in glory. Let them sing for joy on their beds.

6.verse: Let God’s high praises be in their mouth and a two-edged sword in their hand—

7.verse: to execute vengeance upon the nations and rebukes on the peoples,

8.verse: to bind their kings with chains and their nobles with fetters of iron,

9.verse: to carry out the sentence decreed— this is the glory of all His kedoshim. Halleluyah!

1.verse: Praise with Shofar and Cymbals Psalm 150 - Halleluyah! Praise God in His Sanctuary! Praise Him in His mighty expanse.

2.verse: Praise Him for His acts of power. Praise Him for His enormous greatness.

3.verse: Praise Him with the blast of the shofar. Praise Him with harp and lyre.

4.verse: Praise Him with tambourine and dance. Praise Him with string instruments and flute.

5.verse: Praise Him with clash of cymbals. Praise Him with resounding cymbals.

6.verse: Let every thing that has breath praise ADONAI. Halleluyah!
